161354667,"{'steamid': '76561197972538418', 'num_games_owned': 382, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 510, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 490, 'playtime_at_review': 510, 'last_played': 1711288609}",german,"Relatively short Standalone / DLC for AC Black Flag.
Setting is little different, story is okay, but short. If you liked Black Flag, you will enjoy this little extra playtime.
Separate map and some stuff do, it is alright.
I just played the story to complete my AC collection (only 2 titles left now yay).
Technically it is okayish, there are fixes in wsgf for widescreen resolutions.
Performancewise it is very demanding even nowadays in 2024. When all cranked up it still needs some resources. My PC (5800x3d&7900XTX) was getting warm :).
But looks-wise it is still very acceptable for its age.
Get it for a few bucks if you liked black flag or want to complete your collection",1711289528,1711289528,True,0,0,0,0,True,False,False,True,,,

160907447,"{'steamid': '76561198316836129', 'num_games_owned': 198, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 182, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 182, 'last_played': 1595028162}",german,"## Assassin's Creed Freedom Cry: Ein ermutigendes Abenteuer voller Freiheit

**Schrei nach Freiheit** ist ein eigenstÃ¤ndiges Add-on fÃ¼r **Assassin's Creed IV: Black Flag**, das die Spieler in die Haut von AdÃ©walÃ© schlÃ¼pfen lÃ¤sst, einem ehemaligen Sklaven, der zum Assassinen geworden ist. Das Spiel fÃ¼hrt uns nach Saint-Domingue, einem von Sklaverei geplagten Land, und erzÃ¤hlt eine fesselnde Geschichte Ã¼ber Rebellion, Widerstand und den Kampf um Freiheit.

**AdÃ©walÃ© ist ein charismatischer und komplexer Protagonist**, dessen Reise voller emotionaler Momente und moralischer Entscheidungen steckt. Das Spiel wirft wichtige Fragen Ã¼ber die Sklaverei und die Ungerechtigkeit der damaligen Gesellschaft auf und lÃ¤dt den Spieler dazu ein, sich mit diesen Themen auseinanderzusetzen.

**Die Spielwelt von Saint-Domingue ist wunderschÃ¶n und abwechslungsreich**. Von Ã¼ppigen Dschungeln bis hin zu den geschÃ¤ftigen StraÃŸen der Hauptstadt Port-au-Prince bietet die Welt viel Platz zum Erkunden und Entdecken.

**Das Gameplay ist flÃ¼ssig und abwechslungsreich**. Neben den typischen Assassinen-Infiltrationen und Stealth-Missionen bietet Freedom Cry auch spannende Seeschlachten und neue Gameplay-Elemente wie die Befreiung von Sklaven und die Sabotage von Plantagen.
**Die Geschichte ist fesselnd und gut erzÃ¤hlt**. Die Missionen sind abwechslungsreich und voller spannender Momente. Die Charaktere sind gut entwickelt und glaubwÃ¼rdig.
**Die Grafik ist auf einem hohen Niveau** und die AtmosphÃ¤re ist stimmungsvoll. Der Soundtrack ist hervorragend und unterstreicht die emotionale Wirkung des Spiels.

**Fazit:** Assassin's Creed Freedom Cry ist ein empfehlenswertes Spiel fÃ¼r alle Fans der Reihe und fÃ¼r Spieler, die sich fÃ¼r Geschichte und die Thematik der Sklaverei interessieren. Das Spiel bietet eine spannende Geschichte, abwechslungsreiches Gameplay und eine wunderschÃ¶ne Spielwelt.
**Positiv:**
* Charismatischer und komplexer Protagonist
* Fesselnde Geschichte Ã¼ber Rebellion und Freiheit
* Abwechslungsreiches Gameplay
* WunderschÃ¶ne Spielwelt
* Gute Grafik und AtmosphÃ¤re
* Herausfordernde Missionen
**Negativ:**
* Relativ kurze Spielzeit
* Einige technische Probleme
**Bewertung:** 8/10

160170465,"{'steamid': '76561198063825413', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 804, 'playtime_forever': 512, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 512, 'last_played': 1709934359}",german,"Black Flag Jr. war ursprÃ¼nglich ein DLC, wurde dann aber (auch) als eigenstÃ¤ndiges Spiel herausgegeben.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3176059895
[b]Geschichte[/b]

Wir spielen AdÃ¨walÃ¨, der Quartiermeister unter Edward Kenway war und nun, wo dieser vermutlich in England eine ruhige Kugel schiebt, ein eigenes Schiff befehligt. Er ist ehemaliger Sklave mit guten Ãœberzeugungen, Assassine und FreiheitskÃ¤mpfer.

In der interessanten Geschichte, die in Saint-Domingue (dem heutigen Haiti) von 1735 spielt, geht es neben bekannten Themen insbesondere um Sklaverei, Sklavenbefreieungen und um die befreiten Sklaven, den [url=https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maroons]Maroons[/url].

Es wird aber nicht die ganz groÃŸe (historische) Geschichte erzÃ¤hlt, sondern eher nur eine kleine Auseinandersetzung, die, wenn man so will, pars pro toto steht. AdÃ¨walÃ¨s Diskussion mit der Bordellchefin Bastienne Ã¼ber das richtige Vorgehen geht in diese Richtung, es gibt wohl nicht *den* richtigen Weg.

Bei ein paar Dingen habe ich schon die Stirn gerunzelt und vermute mal, sie sind dem Gameplay geschuldet, so die Sache mit den Sklavenschiffen unter Geleitschutz. Auch gab es sicher enorme Gewalt gegen Sklaven, andererseits waren sie ja Eigentum, das man nicht einfach so mal vernichtet, sondern unter Kontrolle hÃ¤lt, was durchaus bedeuten kann, AufsÃ¤ssige zu tÃ¶ten, aber nicht wahllos jeden Sklaven.

War Black Flag von der Stimmung her ein her lustiges Abenteuer, ist dieses Spiel hier dÃ¼ster. Dadurch wird es einfach nicht mit dem Ãœberflieger mithalten kÃ¶nnen. Meine ZurÃ¼ckhaltung liegt aber eher darin begrÃ¼ndet, dass es seine Herkunft als DLC nicht abschÃ¼tteln kann (siehe auch Spielzeit). Dabei wÃ¤re das Thema wirklich gut.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3175620921
[b]Gameplay[/b]
Das Gameplay Ã¤hnelt dem von Black Flag enorm. Ein paar Missionstypen hat man weggelassen oder in der StÃ¼ckzahl enorm reduziert. AuffÃ¤llig, dass die Forts nicht mehr erobert werden mÃ¼ssen.

Neu sind die Sklavenbefreiungsmissionen, von denen es eine ganze Reihe unterschiedlichen Typs gibt. Sehr aufwendig sind die Plantagenbefreiungen bestimmten Typs, bei dem man zu unentdecktem langwierigem Vorgehen gezwungen wird, will man nicht den Tod der zu befreienden Sklaven riskieren.

Ein paar Objekte, wie das eines besonderen Schwerts, sind versteckt und kÃ¶nnen scheinbar nur durch Suchen oder (wie bei mir) per Zufall gefunden werden. Dummerweise galt dies (wohl unbeabsichtigt) auch fÃ¼r ein paar Schatzkisten, die einfach ""verschwunden"" waren.

Das Schiff kann wie in Black Flag aufgerÃ¼stet werden. Der Aufwand hierfÃ¼r ist aber genauso enorm und fÃ¼r die Hauptquest nicht (oder nur ein wenig) erforderlich. Da stimmen die Dimensionen irgendwie nicht.
Insgesamt fÃ¼hlt es sich nach noch mehr Black Flag an, auch wenn das Thema Sklaven ein paar neue Events einfÃ¼gt.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3175621891
[b]Technik[/b]
Technisch ziemlich gut. Das Spiel ist mir nie abgestÃ¼rzt. Dass ein paar Objekte nicht auffindbar waren hat mich schnell davon abgehalten auf 100% zu gehen.
Die Grafik ist sehr schÃ¶n, wie in AC IV, und der Sound ist Ã¤hnlich gut. Die Dialoge sind auf Deutsch.
Die Steuerung per Controller war sehr gut und praktisch wie in Black Flag.
[b]Sonstiges[/b]
Ich habe etwa 4h fÃ¼r die Hauptquest gebraucht und mich vielleicht nochmal 4h mit Nebenaufgaben beschÃ¤ftigt.
[code][b]In Zahlen fÃ¼r mich persÃ¶nlich ein Unterhaltungswert von 7,5/10.[/b][/code]
Ein edler Held auf Sklavenbefreiungsmission. Sonst eher Black Flag in Miniatur.
[hr][/hr]

[i]Dies ist mein subjektiver Spieleindruck. FÃ¼r meine Wertung zÃ¤hlt, wie gut es mich unterhalten hat. Entsprechend der Daumen nach oben oder unten, abhÃ¤ngig davon, ob ich es einem Ã¤hnlich gesinnten Spieler weiterempfehle. Der Spieleindruck eines anderen Spielers kann aber durchaus stark davon abweichen.[/i]

158917768,"{'steamid': '76561198143017996', 'num_games_owned': 109, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1859, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1716, 'last_played': 1708599199}",english,"Would I recommend? Yes, just.
For whatever reason, the Freedom Cry DLC is broken. You can still buy it from Ubisoft but it does. not. work.

The standalone version has a lot of the best bits of Black Flag missing (no sea shanties ?!?!), the map has shrunk, the upgrades are much more limited. And it has lots of the same problems, it glitches, the listening and tailing missions...

Adey is a better lead than Kenway for me, the slave saving mini games are fun, there's no obvious wokery and there is no Animus at all!",1708546593,1708546593,True,1,0,0.487608850002288818,0,True,False,False,True,,,

Ğ—Ğ° 183 Ğ³Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ²Ğ½Ñ‹ Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ¶Ğ½Ğ¾ ĞºÑƒĞ¿Ğ¸Ñ‚ÑŒ 4-ĞºÑƒ Ğ¿Ğ¾ ÑĞºĞ¸Ğ´ĞºĞµ, Ğ³Ğ´Ğµ ÑƒĞ¶Ğµ ÑĞ¸Ğ·Ğ¾Ğ½ Ğ¿Ğ°ÑÑ Ğ² ĞºĞ¾Ğ¼Ğ¿Ğ»ĞµĞºÑ‚Ğµ",1708508954,1708508954,True,0,0,0,0,True,False,False,True,,,

158707254,"{'steamid': '76561198136258977', 'num_games_owned': 60, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 529, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 529, 'last_played': 1708335511}",english,"My overall perspective on this is that this is a IGN 7/10 type game. Not bad, not excellent.
Although, of course, this is because of the price that I got it for Rs. 300 INR, which is roughly 3 dollars USD.
This is a DLC released as a standalone game, so while I would have made considerations for it being a DLC, it being a standalone game negates those, so I will judge it as a full-fledged game.

The story is kinda meh. None of the characters have anything resembling a character arc. The story doesn't go any deeper than freeing slaves and the Maroon revolution, which is fine by me to be honest. Black Flag frustrated me a little bit about the indifference to slavery portrayed by Edward Kenway and his mates, and Freedom Cry rectifies it pretty well.
It is, however, extremely short, and the main missions themselves are not very innovative, nor are the side missions either. It is basically Black Flag with different game textures.
Fortunately, Black Flag had an extremely engaging gameplay loop in the naval combat, and that remains the same here.
I encountered a fair bit of bugs and glitches, but that's par for the course for Assassin's Creed.
TL;DR:
Pros:
Black Flag reskin, so glorious naval combat
Game features fighting to free slaves
Cons:
Everything is too short and not particularly deep.

Feels like a tech demo, an in-between between Black Flag and Rogue, with the blunderbuss being similar to the bomb-gun thingy in Rogue, and a few Voice Actors being re-used from Black Flag and in Rogue as well.

TL;DR TL;DR: Get this if you want to spend a fun few hours in the AC: Black Flag naval combat gameplay loop and you don't want the lengthy story or the extensive side-objectives of Rogue and Black Flag.",1708336443,1708336443,True,0,0,0,0,True,False,False,True,,,

158036390,"{'steamid': '76561198081192905', 'num_games_owned': 389, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 413, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 413, 'last_played': 1707552793}",english,"It's worth getting via the AC Bundle.

157907196,"{'steamid': '76561198000649415', 'num_games_owned': 701, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 242, 'last_played': 1707462379}",english,"Assassin's Creed Freedom Cry takes players on a thrilling journey through the brutal realities of slavery in the Caribbean during the 18th century. Serving as a standalone expansion to Assassin's Creed IV: Black Flag, this game places players in the shoes of AdÃ©walÃ©, a former slave turned Assassin, as he fights for freedom and justice amidst a world plagued by oppression. With its compelling narrative, immersive setting, and engaging gameplay, Assassin's Creed Freedom Cry offers both a poignant commentary on historical injustices and an exhilarating gaming experience. However, it's not without its flaws.
Pros:

Gripping Narrative: Freedom Cry delivers a powerful and emotional storyline, exploring themes of slavery, freedom, and resistance. AdÃ©walÃ©'s personal journey from a slave to an Assassin leader is both compelling and thought-provoking, immersing players in the harsh realities of the era.

Diverse Setting: Set in the vibrant and diverse Caribbean, the game features stunning visuals and richly detailed environments. From bustling cities to sprawling plantations and dense jungles, the world of Freedom Cry feels alive and immersive, offering plenty of opportunities for exploration.

Meaningful Gameplay: The gameplay mechanics of Freedom Cry build upon the foundation laid by Black Flag, offering a seamless blend of stealth, combat, and exploration. Players can engage in thrilling naval battles, liberate slaves, and undertake various missions to undermine the oppressive regime, providing a sense of agency and empowerment.

Social Commentary: Freedom Cry doesn't shy away from addressing the horrors of slavery and the legacy of colonialism. Through its narrative and gameplay, the game prompts players to confront uncomfortable truths about the past while highlighting the resilience and strength of those who fought against injustice.
Cons:

Repetitive Missions: Despite its compelling narrative, Freedom Cry suffers from some repetitive mission structures. Players may find themselves engaging in similar tasks such as freeing slaves or assassinating targets multiple times, which can lead to a sense of monotony over extended play sessions.

Limited Exploration: While the Caribbean setting is visually stunning, the game's world can feel somewhat limited compared to the vast open seas of Black Flag. Players may find themselves craving more opportunities for exploration and discovery beyond the confines of the main story missions.

Occasional Technical Issues: Like its predecessor, Freedom Cry is not without its technical hiccups. Players may encounter occasional bugs, glitches, or performance issues, which can detract from the overall experience and immersion.

In conclusion, Assassin's Creed Freedom Cry offers a compelling and immersive gaming experience that delves into the dark history of slavery in the Caribbean. With its gripping narrative, diverse setting, and meaningful gameplay, it stands as a worthy addition to the Assassin's Creed series. While it may suffer from some repetitive missions and technical issues, its powerful storytelling and social commentary make it a must-play for fans of the franchise and anyone interested in exploring this pivotal period in history.",1707462476,1707462476,True,0,0,0,0,True,False,False,True,,,

154522484,"{'steamid': '76561198137026460', 'num_games_owned': 1255, 'num_reviews': 199, 'playtime_forever': 354, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 354, 'last_played': 1703610889}",english,"[h1] [b] [i] Short but satisfying sub-chapter of Black Flag [/i] [/b] [/h1]

Freedom Cry is a second ""major"" standalone expansion released for the Assassin's Creed franchise (not  counting the Altair's side-games) when it was still in its prime. I went into it cautious as I was very lukewarm about the previous attempt at a large-scale standalone AC companion game, Liberation. I thought that despite its obvious qualities, its sheer mediocrity and drawn-out design did not justify its existence alongside the amazing AC 3. This is why I went into Freedom Cry with tempered expectations even in the light of its overwhelming praise from fans and I have to say - it's actually pretty decent for what it is.
[h1] [i] â€œA: I have killed many men on principle, but never have I wanted one to suffer as much as you - to understand what it is to gasp and beg for your life, like the innocents you drowned.
P: You mean those slaves? That ship? But they are not even human! Without the discipline and guidance of their masters, they turn to rebellion and murder, like you.
A: I only wish that were true.â€ [/i] [/h1]

Unlike in Liberation's case, I have never felt that Freedom Cry has overstayed its welcome. While Adewale's story arc is very reminiscent of that of Aveline (that being freeing slaves and showing them hope in the darkest of times), FC does not manufacture unnecessary story elements just for the sake of content inflation. It has its purpose and it goes about it swiftly and satisfyingly. You  can easily finish the main story in 3-4 hours if you run through it but I have actively wanted to do some of the side-activities which mainly consist of various ways in which you can free slaves around the mainland and adds as pleasant (and relevant story-wise) breaks between main missions.

Freedom Cry genuinely feels different from the game it is based on - AC IV Black Flag. Despite its small scope, it manages a complete shift in focus while integrating the best mechanics from the main game. The large-scale liberating of slaves is contrasting Edward's lust for power and gold and Adewale's playstyle feels different enough from him that it does not just feel like ""More of AC IV on a new map"".

If, after finishing Black Flag, you have not grown tired of the mechanics introduced there and want a short and sweet adventure that shows what Ade was up to after parting ways with Kenway.  It's by no means a revolutionary entry in the franchise (or even a revolutionary DLC) but its such a well-made compact package with perfect pacing where I would not mind going through it again, which is more than I can say for Liberation.
[h2] [b] [u] Positives & Negatives [/u] [/b] [/h2]
[table]
[tr]
[th][b] [i] Positives [/i] [/b][/th]
[th][b] [i] Negatives [/i] [/b][/th]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]+ Short enough to be enjoyable while not getting repetitive[/td]
[td]- The other main characters could have been more fleshed out and interesting[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]+ Adewale is an amazing character and the new added depth suits him[/td]
[td]- There could have been a few more main missions[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]

[td]+ The best part is the difference between Adewale and Kenway's combat styles and the new additions in FC - the less elegant but more impactful machete replacing the dual sabres/swords and the absolute BEAST that is the blunderbuss [/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]+ New types of missions built around the game's primary story focus - freeing of slaves [/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]+ I love the addition of the tribal-themed soundtrack that plays into the game's theme [/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]

143392587,{'steamid': '76561198834977911', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1090, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1090, 'last_played': 1691159776}",french,Very nice,1691160319,1691160319,True,0,0,0,0,True,False,False,True,,,

143337919,"{'steamid': '76561198111154003', 'num_games_owned': 500, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 374, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 374, 'last_played': 1691078605}",english,"This should stay as DLC for Black Flag. [b]Freedom Cry[/b] is good. To put it simple - it's like Black Flag but somebody compressed it.
The whole game can be done in 7h and we're talking about 100% it.

Let's just talk about Freedom Cry as a game as the devs wants it to be. It has its own identity (though still doesn't feel like Assassin's Creed game). The music give off African vibe, keeping that: ""you were a slave too"" thought in your head and making you wanna help as many people as you can.

Which is related to progression too. In any other AC game, you buy your new toys. In Freedom Cry though.... the more slaves you set free, the more equipment you unlock. Itâ€™s a great idea but makes money kinda useless (you use it on ship mostly since one of upgrades from slaves lets you get ammo for free). I feel sailing got pushed back into background. There is not much to explore and missions rather rarely take you out in the open. What made me sad the most is the fact your crew donâ€™t sing while sailing. Yeaâ€¦ itâ€™s a small thing but still it was better to have that.

Letâ€™s talk about weapons Ade uses. Most of them are the same as in Black Flag but he has machete instead two swords, blunderbuss instead of pistols and as an extra firecrackers. That may not seem like much but gives a much more options to complete missions.

The only downside of AC Freedom Cry is the story. Itâ€™s written really well but itâ€™s way too short. Itâ€™s hard to get to know and like all characters. And since the gameâ€™s this short, Adeâ€™s internal change feels way too rushed and kinda hard to believe.
Itâ€™s a great addition to Assassinâ€™s Creed series and I recommend to try it. Itâ€™s worth it",1691084850,1691084850,True,14,0,0.671404004096984863,0,True,False,False,True,,,

143241160,"{'steamid': '76561198982430028', 'num_games_owned': 38, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1690957366}",spanish,"Un DLC sobre nuestro querido AdewalÃ©, su unico defecto es que fue pensado como DLC por lo tanto es corto, se presentÃ³ como juego individual aqui pero merecÃ­a ser un juego completo con una historia mas extensa y mÃ¡s escenarios. Es lo Ãºnico que me apena, en lo demÃ¡s es perfecto. Muy facil quizas, demasiado por la misma razÃ³n, pero la historia sigue la madurez de una historia centrada en su protagonista, como lo es Black Flag sobre Edward. Algo que lamentablemente se ha perdido en la saga, en esta epoca los personajes eran construidos dentro de la trama del juego, tenÃ­an una identidad.",1690949609,1690949670,True,0,0,0,0,True,False,False,True,,,

143207662,"{'steamid': '76561198121200320', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1707, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 636, 'last_played': 1691544945}",english,"I really wanted to play this game (DLC) but how can I play the game if I don't have an activation code?? It took me a while to be able to reconnect with my Ubisoft Connect account (had it for a long time but barely use it) then it asks for an activation key and I don't even have another option to like send me the code via email or text.. It would be nice to have some help from Steam here... I would probably recommend the game, because I loved AC4, but I need to be able to play this one to even want to recommend it..
Edit:

After doing a bunch of looking. I found the game key and got logged into my ubisoft connect that I haven't used in like 10 years. I love AC but this was my first time getting an AC game on PC.. I prefer console for these games usually. I still will recommend game but setting this stuff up was a pain. I wish it was laid out better or there was more of a guide but I appreciate others' comments in helping me find the answers to get this running.",1690902384,1691366330,True,0,0,0.518072307109832764,2,True,False,False,True,,,

142641318,"{'steamid': '76561198060469849', 'num_games_owned': 487, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 928, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 928, 'last_played': 1690115641}",english,"Freedom Cry is pretty much Black Flag, but extremely short. You play as Adewale, I was hoping it would delve into a good portion of his life, instead of a very very minimal part. Visually it relatively the same, but had less of the grainy textures I experienced. There were a few visual bugs that black flag had. Overall it took about 8-10 hours to beat. (I passed out with the game open, what can I say? People need their sleep) Unlike Assassin's Creed Liberation, using a synchronization point in this game actually consistently played the same music. Also compared with Liberation's constant crashing, I only crashed once in the time I was playing Freedom Cry. I bought the game on sale as a standalone, but apparently you can get it with Black Flag definitive edition, I'd suggest doing that instead.",1690116237,1690116237,True,3,0,0.530869066715240479,0,True,False,False,True,,,

142631136,"{'steamid': '76561199093411560', 'num_games_owned': 418, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 252, 'last_played': 1683980028}",english,"One of the few times I've actually felt for NPCs and hated the villains all the more because of it. 142078266,"{'steamid': '76561197996891752', 'num_games_owned': 679, 'num_reviews': 299, 'playtime_forever': 249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 249, 'last_played': 1689359632}",english,"I don't think this DLC stands on its own. 141779494,"{'steamid': '76561199219174224', 'num_games_owned': 289, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 373, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 201, 'last_played': 1690944805}",english,mmm,1689015726,1689015726,True,0,0,0,0,True,False,False,True,,,

141770422,"{'steamid': '76561198927342826', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 624, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 323, 'last_played': 1689159104}",english,"So, I have a lot of issues with this game.  First, the gameplay itself:  I find the combat more janky than in Black Flag and I'm not sure if it's that they just remapped Edward's combat to a bigger body and it doesn't fit quite right or what. I hate that when you die, it takes away all of the progress you made. The previous games leading up to this didn't do that, so you can spend 20 minutes stealthing your way through a mission, meeting all of the objectives, and if you fall off a roof you lose every bit of that progress you have made. I've finished a mission several times now thinking I did all of the objectives only to realize it erased something I did because I got desynchronized at some point. Very frustrating.

Next, the overall story:  It's boring. Ade seems to be narrowed down to a single dimension and the story also seems very one-dimensional. I understand that this is a DLC-type mini-game, but it's still just really lacking.  The fact that the entire game seems to just be around 'free slaves' is one-dimensional in and of itself, but you don't even get the satisfaction of clearing a space for good and getting to be like 'ah yes, I did it, I freed all of the slaves in this area' because they respawn! Quickly! And, if you are a little too empathetic like me, you get tired of constantly going through the same motions so you have to ignore the slaves being auctioned and beaten and killed around you to progress the game and then you feel shitty every time you walk past one of these scenes which is ALL THE TIME. And that leads me to my personal biggest issue with this game...

It seems pretty racist. Now, hear me out. On its surface, it's fine. Former slave goes on a mission to ""liberate"" as many other slaves as he can by hacking his way through slave owners, yay! But when you look at it more closely, there are a lot of issues. For one, Ade himself. Aveline was a fully fleshed character with her own story who also had a history with slavery, dealt with racism, and freed slaves. Ade seems to have one sole goal, despite the fact that he should be a fully fleshed character with his own story and his own goals. Why wasn't Edward singularly obsessed with freeing slaves? Ah, because he wasn't black?  It seems like the game designers don't know what to do with a black protagonist other than center their story around slavery, which shows a lack of thinking of black people as whole people. Also, perhaps most egregious, slaves are LITERAL CURRENCY in the game. You have to get enough of them to unlock upgrades. I'm not sure why no one along the development and editing process thought 'hmm, maybe we shouldn't use a tally of black people as a currency' but they didn't.

I just think they went so heavy-handed with ""anti-slavery"" that they didn't stop to think about the fact that us black people aren't able to be reduced to one thing and that there is far more to our history as people, but also to us as *individuals* than slavery. Very frustrating that the white (and half-white, and Aveline's story was half about slavery so...) characters get to be fully fleshed individuals and the black ones get to be... anti-slavery. :/",1689007150,1689007150,False,6,4,0.525670170783996582,0,True,False,False,True,,,

141478222,"{'steamid': '76561198201049295', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 734, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 729, 'last_played': 1692375082}",english,"I bought this game on sale so it didn't cost much, but after about 11 hours of gameplay and a random update it kept asking for the activation code only to say that it was ""already activated"" and the game could no longer start. I contacted Ubisoft support but they could not fix it even after a lot of communication and eventually they stopped answering. Sucks that it ended up that way since the game seemed awesome when I could play it. It's annoying that it suddenly no longer worked. (also, trying to start the game without actually managing to start it added on another hour to my ""gameplay time""...)

I would like to add (way later now and I replayed it at a friends house on Ps... Turns out I already completed it on my computer before it crashed, I just missed a cut-scene and couldn't 100% it), that the game is really awesome. I personally loved Black flag so this, as a DLC or a standalone game, is brilliant. I only chose not to recommend it because of the error I received which seemed to be on Ubisofts side, not Steam. They somehow couldn't communicate and the problem never got fixed, which is extremely annoying. I WOULD recommend the game, just maybe on a console before steam since Steam and Ubisoft had problems with communication and I wouldn't wish that on someone else for full price.",1688678248,1704712872,False,1,0,0.52173912525177002,0,True,False,False,True,,,

You play as AdÃ©walÃ© your assassins creed 4 former ship mate for kenway.Theres not much new here in terms of gameplay in face a lot of the exploring is gone. You have your collectathon stuff here but it's mostly just treasures.

What is new is saving slaves from around the map. The more slaves you save that more things you unlock which gives you the incentive to save them. You save them by doing various things such as killing guards before they get caught. Finding a key and rescuing them from cages and save them from being beaten before they die.

You get more of a backstory for AdÃ©walÃ© here if you are interested in that sort of thing and the game can be beaten in one sitting so if that interests you then this is worth your time.",1687263746,1687263746,True,0,0,0,0,True,False,False,True,,,

136456384,"{'steamid': '76561199045768715', 'num_games_owned': 225, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 229, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 229, 'last_played': 1681109919}",english,"Assassin's Creed: Freedom Cry is short, but sweet.

The main story only takes 4 hours to complete, throw in the rest of the optional content and it's still only 6-7 hours. It's pretty much a mini AC4: Black Flag. Smaller version of the Caribbean, shorter story, less character development, etc.
I really enjoyed it though! It does have a better moral code than AC4, and the story however short is quite lovely. Wasn't a huge fan of the side characters but Adewale carries, and I'm good with it.
Overall, a 6.5/10, would consider recommending.
TL;DR: It's a mini Black Flag that's still fairly enjoyable.",1681110352,1681258650,True,0,0,0,0,True,False,False,True,,,

130264029,"{'steamid': '76561198315190622', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 394, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 394, 'last_played': 1618598886}",russian,Ñ‡Ğ¸ÑÑ‚Ğ¾ Ñ€Ğ°Ğ´Ğ¸ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ²ĞµÑĞºĞ¸ ÑĞ´ĞµĞ»Ğ°Ğ½Ğ° Ğ¸ Ğ²Ğ½Ğ¸Ğ¼Ğ°Ğ½Ğ¸Ñ Ğ½Ğµ ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ğ¸Ñ‚ Ğ¾Ñ‚ ÑĞ»Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ° Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ¾Ğ±Ñ‰Ğµ,1673006952,1673006952,False,0,0,0.47486037015914917,0,True,False,False,True,,,

130256424,"{'steamid': '76561198973888834', 'num_games_owned': 179, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 262, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 262, 'last_played': 1672994369}",english,"Being only 4 hours long, this game was a blast to play through. A very short and sweet story with very few follow missions thank god. Not throwing stealth away completely, this game trades up stealth for some head on action sequences.
Weapons in Freedom Cry are different as they got rid of swords and daggers. You get machetes for AdÃ©walÃ© instead. (This does not prevent you from picking up and using a sword from a slain enemy.)
No flintlock pistols, just a blunderbuss for you, AdÃ©.
You still have your own pair of Hidden Blades of course.

Much of the in game assets were from Black Flag so the graphics are more or less the same. Game-play wise as well, but again more action than stealth really. And his attack animations, though not as fluid or graceful as i expected assassins would be, he has a sort of brutal flair that really defines him as an assassin. Not just Edward Kenway re-skinned to be AdÃ©walÃ©.

Although I don't agree with the price point of $22.95 AUD due to everything being ""small scale"" compared to Black Flag, I do however highly recommend getting this on sale and absorbing yourself for 4 to 5 hours. Get it however you can as it is a very good game and you won't really regret playing it.

All in all the story has a very noble cause, AdÃ©walÃ©'s mission to liberate the slaves of Port-au-Prince while attempting to spark a revolution is engrossing. For a DLC turned standalone game, it has a lot more content than one would expect. Honestly i thought it was just gonna be a bunch of uninspired self contained missions, but this totally blew me away. It's extremely hard to find a con other than the length. Because of that there isn't much to complain about.
7.5/10 This is exactly what you expect from a DLC. If only present Ubisoft could learn from their past.

128715630,"{'steamid': '76561199441975789', 'num_games_owned': 21, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 5502, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1820, 'last_played': 1672479177}",schinese,æˆ‘è§£æ”¾äº†å…¨å®‡å®™çš„é»‘å¥´,1671270205,1671270205,True,7,5,0.614174604415893555,0,True,False,False,True,,,

128704085,"{'steamid': '76561198373502045', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 193, 'playtime_forever': 314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1686939731}",english,"Assassin's Creed: Freedom Cry.
While not throwing stealth away completely, this game trades up stealth for some head on action sequences.
You play as Adewale, 15 years after the events of Assassin's Creed IV: Black Flag.
Older, wiser and now a fully trained assassin. He even gets his own murder hood.

Much of the in game assets were from ACIV:BF so the graphics are more or less the same. Gameplay wise as well, but again more action than stealth really. And his attack animations, though not as fluid or graceful as i expected assassins would be, he has a sort of brutal flair that really defines him as an assassin. Not just Edward Kenway reskinned to be Adewale.
Weapons in Freedom Cry are different as they got rid of swords and daggers. You get machetes for Adewale instead. (This does not prevent you from picking up and using a sword from a slain enemy.)
No flintlock pistols, just a blunderbuss for you, Ade.
You still have your own pair of Hidden Blades of course.

The whole campaign itself is short and sweet. It left me wanting more from it, more of what happens to Adewale, more of what becomes of the liberated slaves and their resistance and more of what happened to the Assassins after Black Flag.
For a DLC turned standalone game, it has a lot more content than one would expect.
Honestly i thought it was just gonna be a bunch of uninspired self contained missions, but this totally blew me away.
I dare say Adewale was more fun to play with than Connor. But of course, that is my opinion.

Get it on sale if you feel that $15 is still too much. Get it however you can as it is a very good game and you won't really regret playing it.",1671252414,1671252414,True,16,3,0.366248488426208496,1,True,False,False,True,,,

125463692,{'steamid': '76561198063271193', 'num_games_owned': 272, 'num_reviews': 404, 'playtime_forever': 441, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 441, 'last_played': 1668429415}",english,"Despite this being a DLC for some reason steam has this as a seperate game. This is small, even smaller than liberation. The storyline is great and very fitting for Adewale and definitely works well.
What doesn't work well is the port to pc. The framerate is really bad in some places and can really affect gameplay, however it wasn't always bad and i pushed through to the end.

I enjoyed the game otherwise but i found the ""random event"" slave liberations far too frequent, crossing over into one another making for a confusing time. Also there were far too many enemies(guards and slavers) always looking out for trouble in such small locations.
Despite this it has many great mechanics from black flag as well as some new ones.
Unfortunately i cannot recommend this on steam. The port can make it completely unplayable for some people and just not worth the effort.
If you can get it on sale on console do that and you will have less problems.",1668434531,1668434664,False,9,2,0.626488208770751953,0,True,False,False,True,,,

120305594,"{'steamid': '76561198046016487', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 384, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 384, 'last_played': 1660004878}",english,"Very bland dlc... very repetitive. Tail this person... free slaves... free some more slaves because the mission requires more to be freed to be unlocked. Free this plantation, and tail some more people... just seems to be very meh, almost like there was a lot of grinding with how repetitive the free slave events were. Ship upgrades were done within the first few hours of play, all rewards are given after freeing 400 slaves, which can be done pretty quickly by taking slave ships. I get it, it was a dlc, not a full game, just felt like there could've been more done to make this dlc seem more awesome, just a little over 6 hours and I beat it, that was also taking into consideration the troubleshooting I took to setup the controller as it was acting weird, and some of the running around just killing guards because I got bored. But anyways, the idea of Adewale (probably spelled the name wrong) going around fighting against slavery = awesome idea. Story, though, just wasn't well written in my opinion and it seemed rushed.",1660005515,1660005515,False,5,0,0.558528423309326172,0,True,False,False,False,,,

120056252,"{'steamid': '76561197963704002', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 463, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 463, 'last_played': 1659625925}",english,"[h1]Meh[/h1]

If you liked [i]Black Flag[/i], you'll probably like this since [i]Assassin's Creed Freedom Cry[/i] is the exact same game on a smaller scale. At best, I would describe this game as a distraction. It's not bad, per se, but it's not good either.
[h1]The Story[/h1]

As far as I can tell, this game doesn't really have a narrative you can hang on to. It starts with Adewale liberating a Templar package and immediately being cast ashore without a ship. Then stuff happens. It feels confused as to what it wants the story to be. There are three narratives all happening simultaneously:
- The Templar Package
- Liberating the Slaves
- The Scientific Expedition
None of these get resolved.
- The package is cast aside for the other 2 narratives, and makes an appearance at the end. What was it? Who knows.

- For as many slaves as you liberate, you never actually liberate Saint Domingue, not even for a moment. You don't lead a rebellion.[spoiler] You just kill the governor and are told he will just be replaced[/spoiler]. Cool.
- The scientific expedition to measure the circumference of the earth is infiltrated by your Maroons, and then...? Literally nothing comes of it. Everything in this game is of no consequence.

I do find it hard to believe Ubisoft couldn't find something interesting happening in the early 1700's Caribbean. And even if this was meant to tell a losing story, they didn't really deliver any impact. You really are left with, ""Thanks Ade, all this busy work will all pay off in 60 or so years."" Maybe have the first few missions be Adewale, and the last half be the slave rebellion where his grandchild plays a major roll?
The story is just not engaging. I regularly forgot what was happening and the game can be finished in an afternoon.
[h1]The Gameplay[/h1]

It's exactly like [i]Black Flag[/i]. The additions are RNG world events that give you the opportunity to free slaves. Most of these are a waste of time, yielding you 2-5 slaves/Maroons, whereas raiding a plantation or a slave ship will get you 30-100. The world events are a distraction, more so during missions where they are not disabled for some reason. So if you get distracted on a mission, and you fail (e.g. you are seen and the mission specifies you can't be), you also fail the mission. Fun.

Missions still have a bunch of nonsensical side objectives like killing 5 guards with a blunderbuss on a stealth mission. Ubisoft maintained the tradition of making these necessary to get 100% completion. It's amazing how long they held on the that terrible piece of design. Since there is no reward beyond getting 100%, I just skipped any I didn't incidentally get.

Upgrades come easy. The more slaves you free, the better equipment you get. This can also be a bit grindy since slave ships and plantations are on a cool down timer. Nothing is more grindy than upgrading your ship.

You need a shit ton of wood and metal which you can only get by raiding ships. This means sailing around trying to find ships with wood and/or metal, raiding them, and doing it again and again and again. Luckily, this game is not hard, and you really don't need those upgrades. But if that's your idea of fun, have at it.

The side content is also most generously described as a distraction. Most of it is small islands with a single treasure chest. The first time that happened, I was a bit disappointed. Then it happened again. And again. And again. Ubisoft, if you're gonna pad the game, at least make it interesting.

Sailing to a remote island that the game has pointed out for you, to get pretty much nothing, sucks. This could honestly be fixed if you remove the map markers. That way, players get a sense of, ""Oooo I wonder what's on that island!"" Then, even if it's only one treasure chest, it feels like you [i]found[/i] something. It's a little secret, and you found it! Instead, it's, ""Hey, look over here. There's something on this island, don't you wanna see???"" You are enticing the player to go to a spot, the understanding is it will be something significant. It's the difference between finding a quarter, and someone saying, ""I put something cool over by that tree!"" Then you go to the tree and find a lousy quarter.
[h1]Overall[/h1]

If you like [i]Assassin's Creed[/i] you'll likely find this to be a an enjoyable, short little romp. It's a competent game. I didn't run into any bugs. I liked the traditional music, and the idea of kinda maybe starting a slave rebellion. But overall, it was just a hollow experience. It doesn't contribute really anything to the main series. It's a distraction.

Quick shout out to Ubisoft who made me purchase this game even though I had the DLC version for [i]Black Flag[/i] that, for some reason, they couldn't activate on my account, and instead repeatedly accused me of pirating the game, then deleted my [i]Black Flag[/i] save file. They made it up to me by restoring my save file in a corrupted and irreparable state.

118927159,"{'steamid': '76561198091494295', 'num_games_owned': 865, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 1800, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1800, 'last_played': 1658010539}",english,"As a standalone expansion version to the Black Flag DLC, I do have to say that Freedom Cry is one of the better DLC campaigns put out. Still, with price, youâ€™re better off waiting for a sale or just playing the game through Black Flag. Even when considering it seems the only issue/difference is that the Black Flag version has a bug where certain weapons donâ€™t make sounds, Iâ€™d still say the Black Flag version wins out (you can also copy the sound files from this version to fix the issue too, hint hint).

For the most part, Freedom cry plays like a smaller, more condensed version of Black Flag. You still have the fun ship combat and exploration, though theyâ€™re more limited in upgrades, locations, and collectibles. Most unlocks and upgrades end up being relegated to secret-finding or freeing slaves/maroons, which is a nice change of pace.

Still, the main issue of Freedom Cry is that it is exceedingly short. Most island locations really only have one to three chests to unlock, and with only 9 main missions to complete, most people can easily finish everything this game has to offer in under 10 hours.

All in all, while I do recommend the experience of Freedom Cry, it comes with the qualification that it is very short and is best purchased as part of Black Flag or at a heavy discount. If youâ€™re the type of person who wants some more Black Flag gameplay, this should be a nice little time waster for you (and if you still want more, just get Assassinâ€™s Creed Rogue. Itâ€™s actually almost a full-length Assassinâ€˜s Creed Game for only a slightly higher price).",1658010575,1658010575,True,0,0,0,0,True,False,False,False,,,

117131239,{'steamid': '76561198031382145', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1655479649}",english,"My 43 minutes ""playing"" are, in fact, messing around with the custom launcher which got downloaded, crashed, refused to accept the CD key which Steam had, and a bunch of time waiting for UBSort support to reply to chat messages.
If a game is on Steem, it should work out of the box and not require custom launchers. THat's literally what steam is.

I knew there was a reason that I had gone and hidden all UBSoft games from my Steam account. I thought maybe it was gameplay. Nope. It's the launcher issue, I think. I will wait until this is a Steam game before buying it on Steam, and I don't like having multiple launchers.
If you want to play it, I recommend you go buy direct from UBSoft so that their launcher might work.",1655480105,1655480105,False,5,1,0.533510684967041016,0,True,False,False,False,,,

113502506,"{'steamid': '76561198813287393', 'num_games_owned': 3407, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 589, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 589, 'last_played': 1649379731}",english,"Ubisoft has started REMOVING single player games (yes, base games, not just online DLC) that customers BOUGHT, from their library.

If you are thinking about buying this game (and ""BUY"" is the plain wording on every Steam store page), be aware you may only be able to play it for the next 6 weeks, before Ubisoft REMOVES it from your library.

Ubisoft also thinks it is clever to put the game on promotion for new suckers just before REMOVING the game.  Ie AC Liberation HD was on promotion price last week during the Steam summer sale, this week the store page says the game will no longer playable in 6 weeks time.

The Steam store pages (links below) for AC Liberation HD, and Silent Hunter 5, both have notices saying ""Please note this title will not be ACCESSIBLE following September 1st, 2022"".  Even though you BOUGHT these single player games, you will not be able to access them.

Ignore my previous review below, I am setting my review on every Ubisoft game I own to negative.  If you think this practice is unacceptable, please comment, upvote the review, or leave your own review.
https://store.steampowered.com/app/260210/Assassins_Creed_Liberation_HD/
https://store.steampowered.com/app/48110/Silent_Hunter_5_Battle_of_the_Atlantic/
80/100 A really fun 10 hour expansion to Black Flag, which can be purchased as a standalone game, or as a DLC addon to Black Flag.
I really enjoyed freeing slaves, the naval battles, and the beautiful Caribbean setting.  It's fairly short but really enjoyable.

It has the usual Ubisoft rubbish ie poor QA and testing, with a very frustrating bug during the Tail Louis Godin mission, which contiually (more than a dozen times, in different locations, including after Steam verify install and PC restart) left the hub display going but game world went black.  It didn't happen anywhere else, I had to abandon the mission and sink some ships for a while and come back, eventually I found an angle of attack that made it through.",1649380593,1657532024,False,0,1,0,0,True,False,False,False,,,

111061901,"{'steamid': '76561198964303232', 'num_games_owned': 59, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 649, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 363, 'last_played': 1704596572}",koreana,;),1645871192,1662728747,True,0,0,0,0,True,False,False,False,,,

110675426,"{'steamid': '76561198025030419', 'num_games_owned': 661, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 684, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 684, 'last_played': 1645414469}",english,"This is the shortest Assassin's Creed ""game"" there is. It's not a full novel, it's more of a novella. If you can get it for cheap (or free as part of DLC for AC4: Black Flag) then I recommend you play it for the story. It's a short, powerful story that I almost missed because of a few factors.
So here are my critiques:

- It's the second AC game with a black character, and it also happens to be the second AC game that is all about liberating slaves. It would be nice to have a black character that just is, but maybe that's my privilege talking, I don't know.

- It's ALL about rescuing slaves. And the game is realistic in that you can never rescue all the slaves. No matter how many slaves you liberate, there will always be another slaver walking down the street escorting a few more slaves. There are always slave ships in the West Indies to be liberated. Your job is NEVER done. When you start the game, that is extremely depressing.
- The game is VERY short. They set up so much to do with upgrading your ship and the Maroons' Hideout, it's almost like the game is unfinished.

All that said, I still recommend the game for the story. It gets pretty intense, emotionally, and I'm glad I played it, for all it's flaws. It's not ESSENTIAL to the AC story continuum, but it's a good, quick read. You can probably finish it in about 5 hours.",1645415561,1645415561,True,1,0,0.496774196624755859,0,True,False,False,False,,,

105633794,"{'steamid': '76561198807413314', 'num_games_owned': 202, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 552, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 552, 'last_played': 1580989318}",turkish,Ben Black Flag'dan sonra Ã§ok sÄ±kÄ±ldÄ±m ama seriden baÄŸÄ±msÄ±z oynanabilir.,1639224436,1639224436,True,0,0,0,0,True,False,False,False,,,

105211462,"{'steamid': '76561198191245050', 'num_games_owned': 258, 'num_reviews': 228, 'playtime_forever': 612, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1666293131}",english,"Assassin's Creed Freedom Cry is a stand-alone game that was originally a DLC addition for Assassin's Creed IV: Black Flag.
Set between the years of 1735 to 1737, you play as Adewale, a man who was born a slave but later found freedom as a pirate on Edward Kenway's ship, the Jackdaw.

Fast forward 15 years and Adewale is now a trained Assassin, shipwrecked in Saint-Domingue, off the coast of Haiti, with no weapons and no crew to help him, he has to find a ship in Port-au-Prince, and gather a brand-new crew, so he can free the slaves, and kill those who enslaved them.

Although a short game at about 3 hours, considering this was a DLC addition, that is a fair amount of gameplay you get without having to purchase Assassin's Creed IV: Black Flag, and enough to give you the taste of the main game, and perhaps help convince you to purchase that.

The storyline in Freedom Cry is pretty good, as you would expect from any Assassins Creed game, lots of conspiracies to uncover, different gameplay modes including fighting enemies with a ship, the usual on land Assassins Creed activities, as well as deep dialog and cut scenes.

I am a big Assassin's Creed fan, and I have most of the games, except Assassin's Creed IV, so when the cance came to get Freedom Cry I jumped at it, as to be brutally honest I still have a lot of other Assassin's Creed games to finish, so being able to play a 3 hour game was just about perfect.
The Good

Excellent Graphics that you come to expect from any Assassin's Creed game, the high quality of everything in this franchise is something that should be appreciated. The story on this game is great, and the gameplay itself is top notch.
The Bad
If you are a fan of the Assassin's Creed Franchise then there is no bad here.
Overall
Want a taste of the Assassin's Creed Franchise as a newcomer, then this is a perfect short introduction, experienced in the Franchise and want to play them all, then you cant miss this.
I score Assassin's Creed Freedom Cry a strong 9/10

103147620,"{'steamid': '76561198122873679', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 412, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 412, 'last_played': 1637426106}",english,"I have been trying to get caught up on my backlog of ACC games. Completed Rogue, Blackflag, and this one all in the past month and a half.  This is a nice stand alone DLC for Blackflag, (Be sure to play Blackflag first).  Take's about 6 hours to complete the game.  You can spend more time trying to 100%.  You will spend most of your time freeing slaves but can also hunt for treasure and animals and do some harpoon fishing for sharks to help break up the repetitiveness of attacking plantations  and slave ships.  Overall a nice side story to accompany Blackflag.",1637426561,1637426561,True,7,1,0.604211390018463135,0,False,False,False,False,,,

102804510,"{'steamid': '76561198001198139', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 972, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 972, 'last_played': 1636941587}",english,"I enjoyed Freedom Cry. AdÃ©walÃ© is a seriously cool hero that makes Edward Kenway look somewhat lame and sleazy by comparison. The subject matter is bold for a AAA and really lets you see the world of Black Flag from a whole new perspective. The ship battle music is simply amazing and helps make sea combat distinct from Black Flag. On the bad side, It doesn't seem to be optimized well for PC. I can run Black Flag at max settings and the frame rate is silky smooth... but in Freedom Cry (which should in theory be exactly the same) is very choppy by comparison, I had to lower my settings and turn off vsync to get a playable experience. The story is pretty good, but lacks the depth and character of Black Flag. I feel like there is a lot of missed potential in terms of missions, they really could have made it epic with just a bit more effort. The AI is a bit dumb compared to Black Flag. Those points aside, it's a decent value and an overall worthy gaming experience.",1636942895,1636942895,True,0,0,0,0,True,False,False,False,,,

101450341,"{'steamid': '76561198092862237', 'num_games_owned': 446, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 472, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 472, 'last_played': 1631991437}",english,"From expansion to standalone title.

[i]Assassin's Creed Freedom Cry[/i] is an action-adventure downloadable content developed by Ubisoft QuÃ©bec and published by Ubisoft, first released as a part of Season Pass to [i]Assassin's Creed IV: Black Flag[/i], currently also available as a standalone title!
[b]Story[/b]
I recommend playing Assassin's Creed Black Flag before getting into this entry.
Freedom Cry is set 20 years after events that took place in Black Flag.
You play as Adewale, once a slave and right-hand man of Edward Kenway, now a member of Assassin brotherhood.

During his attempt to intercept Templar activity in the Carribean Sea, he is shipwrecked off the coast of Haiti, where he gets involved with Maroons into liberating slaves and fighting for their cause.
[b]Gameplay[/b]
Take Black Flag, make it smaller, replace piracy theme with slavery and voila!
Main elements are the same. Open world featuring naval and land combat/exploration, with progression focused on completing missions and slave liberation.

Biggest change outside of map size which now has been scaled down to being just a mere chunk of Caribbean Sea, comes in activities you can do while roaming. Most of them is now focused on already mentioned slave liberation.

No more forts, assassination contracts or collectibles hunting, here you liberate slaves from auctions or plantations, save those who are wounded or intercept ships with human cargo on board. Every saved person counts as for reaching milestones in that department you get rewarded by receiving new weapons or pouches increasing your item capacity.
Naval combat and exploration remain untouched, with only difference being in ship state, as game features less upgrade options so you can tackle bigger opponents straight from the start.
You still can board enemy ships and plunder them in order to gain materials you might sell or keep for upgrades.
On the ground, instead of two swords Adewale is using a machete, and as a replacement for a pistol he chose blunderbuss so now you can eliminate multiple enemies with a single well placed shot.
He also has new item to play with, firecrakers, which can distract opponents with their noise.
[b]Playtime, replayability and other modes[/b]
It took me 8 hours to complete everything Freedom Cry has to offer, that is 100% missions, exploring, collecting and fully upgrading my ship.
It doesn't have a lot of replayability, plus like most AC titles it offers option of continuing after the ending if you want to replay specific missions, further explore or engage in combat.
Only Single Player story is available.
[b]Pros and cons[/b]

Freedom Cry keeps good elements from Black Flag, including naval gameplay and stealth mechanics, plus adds new activities fitting with a narrative which make it stand out from main game. Story doesn't drag on and additional character development of Adewale is appreciated as his journey was cut rather short in main game.

However, removal of every single activity that was in Black Flag took a toll on exploration, where beside few unique weapons or upgrades you can only collect more coin chests, making this aspect feel unnecessary and boring at times, even with replacement game offers.
Plus keeping most expensive ship upgrades means you still will spend a good moment grinding to obtain resources to improve it, one of less popular elements of Black Flag.
Guess that's a one way to keep player busy for a bit longer.
Also standalone version of the game doesn't have shanties! Unthinkable.
[b]Final words and conclusion[/b]

If you are wondering about the differences between DLC and Standalone version of Freedom Cry, from what I could gather there aren't any, beside already mentioned lack of shanties in standalone version. However dlc has some audio issues from what I've read and obviously you need to own Black Flag before being able to play Freedom Cry.
Assassin's Creed Freedom Cry brings out more of gameplay known from Black Flag, with new storyline and activities that fit  into new theme. Short, but a decent adventure nonetheless.
Check out [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/31947302/] my curator page for more reviews! [/url]",1634925351,1634925758,True,46,1,0.835142016410827637,9,True,False,False,False,,,

95630083,"{'steamid': '76561199177676493', 'num_games_owned': 36, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 717, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 280, 'last_played': 1647179779}",english,no,1626130720,1626130720,True,0,0,0.427293449640274048,0,True,False,False,False,,,

95539142,"{'steamid': '76561198808110995', 'num_games_owned': 577, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 541, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 541, 'last_played': 1625971105}",english,"I have played almost every AC game but unfortunately Freedom Cry escaped my little completionist hands for YEARS!

But this last Summer sale I picked it up and decided I would start to stream games again! I played this standalone expansion of AC Black Flag since it featured Adewale who I really enjoyed in AC Black Flag.

The story is really nice and has some hard hitting moments that just remind you that while this is a short side story game. It's still a high quality experience you should expect to enjoy. I wish the story hadn't stopped 9 missions in!

The gameplay is as good as AC Black Flag so if you enjoyed Black Flag; you'll like it! If you haven't even played Black Flag you need to play that first since Freedom Cry seems to take place after the game.

The location is very important since most of us these days expect a nice map grind at the LEAST! And I'm not going to lie in Black Flag I loved every inch of that sea filled map! But in Freedom Cry very few locations of the handful of locations were actually interesting. A lot of empty islands with a chest maybe. It just falls short in the location. The areas that are nice; are quite nice. But overall not a lot of reason to explore the whole map unless you're a completionist like me.
Overall, the game is pretty cheap and is a solid experience for the price and expectations of it!",1626011023,1626011023,True,0,0,0,0,True,False,False,False,,,

94593607,"{'steamid': '76561198045377291', 'num_games_owned': 1686, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 197, 'last_played': 1624897397}",english,"Fairly decent expansion to Assassin's Creed IV. Been a while since I played that game so had to get used to the controls again.

Story alone take about 3 hours to complete so it's short but there is loads of side activities to keep you busy, so really more likely 8 to 10 hours to do everything. As you can see I just focused on the story.

Navel combat is fun as well as the general assassination gameplay. Basically the same side-activities from IV with the addition of Plantations. You have the side-activity of freeing slaves which goes towards unlocking better gear for your character which is interesting.
Pretty fun expansion to be honest.",1624897751,1624897751,True,0,0,0,0,True,False,False,False,,,

93375791,"{'steamid': '76561198042383071', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 249, 'playtime_forever': 483, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 483, 'last_played': 1623100413}",english,"Solid game and definitely another Assassin's Creed game with roughly ~7-10 hours of gameplay. I was initially interested because of the AC: Black Flag tie-ins but I found this game definitely stands on its own two legs and doesn't lean into AC: Black Flag much at all (which is both a good and bad thing).

Outside of the gameplay the story definitely hits on some heavy tones in the story about slavery, racism, and more. One fascinating feature to this game was that you could build up a resistance by saving people ultimately making your forces bigger and bigger. This ultimately concluded with no real pay-off in the story or mission fighting alongside your resistance and was just a means to an end with upgrading equipment. I think if this game executed the resistance in a more meaningful way I would be stoked about this game. Unfortunately since it didn't, I still recommend this game but know what you are walking into and maybe wait for a sale!",1623101200,1623101200,True,7,0,0.601656556129455566,0,True,False,False,False,,,

91765976,"{'steamid': '76561198006349779', 'num_games_owned': 216, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 257, 'last_played': 1440296634}",brazilian,"Resolvi fazer um review a parte porque o game praticamente Ã© um outro, tanto que o que eu comprei foi o Standalone pack.

O game tem um enredo bem interessante, com o AdewelÃ© lutando pela liberdade dos escravos em Porto PrÃ­ncipe e arredores. O gameplay Ã© bem variado, vc ajuda os escravos de diversas formas. E libertar os escravos dos navios negreiros, usando a mesma tÃ¡tica de abordar navios na pirataria de Black Flag foi uma boa sacada.

E o AdewelÃ© Ã© bem mais violento. NÃ£o sÃ³ porque ele Ã© mais forte mas o cara usa um fucking facÃ£o pra lutar. E crava o facÃ£o na cabeÃ§a, nas pernas. As lutas sÃ£o brutais. Ainda mais estando meio que com sangue nos zÃ³i de ver os escravos sofrendo.
A missÃ£o perto do final no navio negreiro foi tensa. Entra pra lista de missÃµes tensas/emocionantes da sÃ©rie e atÃ© dos jogos no geral.

Ah, as mÃºsicas sÃ£o muito fodas, elas combinam demais. DÃ£o todo um ar Ã©pico pro game. E aqui, trocaram a cantoria dos piratas pelas cantorias dos escravos nas plantaÃ§Ãµes de aÃ§Ãºcar. TÃ£o boas quanto.
E um fato curioso. Eu achei a dublagem aqui mais bem trabalhada. Sincronia e voz estavam mais de acordo do que em Black Flag. Provavelmente por ser um game menor e ter saÃ­do depois.
No geral, vou dar uma nota maior que BF porque ele Ã© um BF com um acabamento melhor.

91232341,"{'steamid': '76561198138786964', 'num_games_owned': 360, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 529, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 529, 'last_played': 1619878828}",english,"After releasing Assassin's Creed III and accompanying it with a smaller release, Assassin's Creed Liberation, Ubisoft thought of doing the same with Assassin's Creed IV and expand on the beautiful Caribbean world they crafted under the form of Assassin's Creed Freedom Cry.

Both the DLC and Standalone versions are one and the same which kinda degrades from the Standalone copy, it definitely feels like an Assassin's Creed game but not as feature-complete as its parent release, Assassin's Creed IV which is understandable but the introduction of new weapons and firearms really was a fantastic selling point for the game. Not only that but new gameplay mechanics were introduced that related to the main character and his story, freeing slaves and building up a revolutionary front.

The campaign is quite short and predictable and the exploration area feels very dwarfed when compared to the other games, but nonetheless, quite a great deal of fun this game was.",1619880287,1619880287,True,0,0,0,0,True,False,False,False,,,

90600669,{'steamid': '76561198114628232', 'num_games_owned': 1734, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 368, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 243, 'last_played': 1618946809}",english,"I never rage quit as much as I rage quit in Black Flag and Freedom Cry. The game is not hard, the stories are cool, the setting is awesome, but the controls are some of the most atrocious, frustrating, rage inducing in any game I have ever played. The characters you control never do what they have to, the auto lock system that can't be disabled always forces you on paths you don't want to take. You want to jump forward? ow, look, something to lock on to the left and automatically change direction. You want to run past enemies? Oh, let's lock onto them, stop running and get beaten. You want to jump from a ledge onto an enemy? oh, look, another ledge, let's lock on to that, get discovered and fuck up the entire mission. I swear I've been fighting more with the camera and the controls than with the enemies. Thank got they ditched this gameplay system in later installments",1618872309,1618872309,False,0,0,0.462809920310974121,0,True,False,False,False,,,

90163963,"{'steamid': '76561198336656213', 'num_games_owned': 841, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 396, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 396, 'last_played': 1618136155}",english,"Played using max settings and SMAA at 4K 60 fps (AMD Ryzen 3800x, RX 6800 XT and 32 GB DDR4 RAM) using a ReShade preset.
Gameplay: 8/10 - Good old Assassin's Creed 4 style combat.
Story: 6.5/10 - Overall enjoyable, but nothing special. Didn't put me to sleep.
Graphics: 7/10 - Looks good for 2014.
Music and sound design: 6.5/10 - Soundtrack had a recognizable motif, but was not memorable. SFX decent.
Replayability: 5/10 - Small map. Nothing left to do once you finish the story and grab the few collectibles.

A formulaic, standalone DLC entry for AC4 Black Flag, this third-person action/adventure game follows Adewale, a freed slave that used to ride with Black Flag's protagonist Edward Kenway. Adewale's combat style is distinct from Kenway's and definitely felt good, but it's really just more of the same.
The story was an enjoyable experience, especially if you really wanted to know more about him and his convictions following on his appearance in Black Flag; however, it is nothing to cry home about.

There is very limited weapon customization, and no appearance customization at all for Adewale. I accidentally stumbled upon the best machete in the game just exploring on my ship following the first memory sequence. The best ranged weapon comes from 100% synch-ing the short main story, which I was able to do in 6 hours along with obtaining all chests and collectibles.

Freedom Cry looks and runs great on modern hardware, but is capped at 60 fps with horrible screen tearing even with AMD Freesync Premium if the in-game Vsync is turned off, so I recommend playing with Vsync ON.

Overall, if you enjoy the formulaic style of Assassin's Creed games prior to Origins, Freedom Cry is a great short adventure, and worth picking up for cheap.",1618189833,1618189833,True,0,0,0,0,True,False,False,False,,,

85506359,"{'steamid': '76561197986301871', 'num_games_owned': 654, 'num_reviews': 112, 'playtime_forever': 678, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 678, 'last_played': 1611848701}",english,"Got this on sale and it's worth it for what I paid. It's a good story, but not really an Assassin's Creed story. It feels less polished than the main game and I had a lot of trouble with weird glitches and odd behaviour of AI, as well as unresponsive controls that just made me angry. An example of the latter is failing to use human shield as the npc I'm trying to use suddenly glitches and is too far away to be used, then I take shot damage. Also difficulties with boarding ships, often I had to just dive into the water and swim to the ship I was boarding and fight alone. Speaking of ships, the ship you sail in this feels as nimble as a brick...it's a pain to sail, and it would stop sailing, go backwards, and then go the opposite way I was intending to go. But aside from the lack of polish, I overall enjoyed this and think it's well worth it on sale. Don't pay full price for it, not ever.",1611849017,1611849017,True,0,1,0,0,True,False,False,False,,,

84600692,"{'steamid': '76561197992717410', 'num_games_owned': 354, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 275, 'last_played': 1564429889}",russian,"ĞšĞ°Ğº Standalone DLC Ğ½ĞµĞ»Ğ¾Ñ…Ğ¾, Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ½ĞµĞ¼Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ ÑĞºÑƒÑ‡Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ¾.",1610528306,1610528306,True,0,0,0,0,True,False,False,False,,,

84455838,"{'steamid': '76561198076705047', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 815, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 815, 'last_played': 1610314314}",english,"I am kind of at two minds about this. In terms of the game itself from a mechanical standpoint it's pretty good. But after all it is just Black Flag. The only changes are that pistols are replaced by a BFG in the form of a blunderbus and that the swords are now machetes. So I cannot give it points for being good as it's mostly a reskin of Black Flag. That being said this one really has no reason to exist aside from a ""Let's make one with slaves in it!"" Story has always been the strong suit of th AC games and considering that Adewale is not a one trick pony in the story of later games this was a missed chance to tell more pieces of his story. Really nothing happens aside from his meeting his future baby mama. There's a governor who controls a slave trade in a region and Adewale frees some slaves then kill said governor. The End.
In any case, this is a Black Flag lite, for those who don't care about the story. It could serve as a demo.",1610314857,1610314857,False,0,0,0.47826087474822998,0,True,False,False,False,,,

84207655,"{'steamid': '76561198353897458', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 137, 'playtime_forever': 737, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 737, 'last_played': 1600455143}",english,"Freedom Cry is a game, that lets you play AC IV from a different angle (I bought the standalone version instead of the DLC for ""Black Flag""). This angle is the career of AdÃ©walÃ©, the former quartermaster on Edward Kenway's ship in Black Flag, after what happened in Assassin's Creed IV. The game is short but if you have played Black Flag before this, it is a nice continuation of the story. Map, gameplay-mechanics and functionalities are similar to Black Flag. It is a nice little additional story to Black Flag but can also be played independently, e.g. if you want to get a taste of what Black Flag feels like (although the story is not in chronological order then). Shanties, graphics etc are also there! Runs without major problems on a WIN10 1909 gaming-PC.",1610010501,1610010501,True,1,0,0,0,True,False,False,False,,,

83544776,"{'steamid': '76561198027961382', 'num_games_owned': 192, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 705, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 705, 'last_played': 1609307718}",english,"If you liked AC4: Black Flag or AC: Rogue, you'll love this.  You're essentially getting 8 more memories set in that same time period, only from the perspective of Adewale, the quartermaster from Black Flag.  Gameplay is the typical excellent fare of those games.  The graphics look great and it runs well.  Highly recommended.

NOTE: I've seen places mention that you get 3 hours of gameplay with this add-on.  Maaaaaybe if you don't do anything at all other than the story missions and do them quickly.  If you aim for 100% sync at all you're looking at 9+ hours easy.",1609311602,1609311602,True,0,0,0,0,True,False,False,False,,,

83526570,"{'steamid': '76561198157068682', 'num_games_owned': 280, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 331, 'last_played': 1609290382}",english,"I bought the standalone version over the DLC version because I read there was an issue with a missing sound in the DLC version. Apparently this version is missing sea shanties though, so you can't really win either way. I usually turn the sea shanties off though, so this was the version I went with.

Assassin's Creed Freedom Cry is an extension of the Black Flag story. I wouldn't play this unless you've already completed Black Flag. I really like how they added some gameplay elements instead of just reskining Edward. Adewale fights with a machete, which I feel fits his character more than two pirate cutlasses would. You also get a blunderbuss, which is a pretty cool addition. The missions and naval combat are more of what you're familiar with, and you can upgrade the ship as per usual.

The biggest gameplay addition this time around is freeing slaves. As you free slaves, you'll get new unlocks like bigger ammo pouches and upgraded weapons. I'm sure most people feel pretty good when they're freeing slaves, so it's nice to be able to have those kind of feel good moments in games.

The story is short but sweet. You follow Adewale (the Jackdaw's quartermaster from Black Flag) who is shipwrecked whilst pursuing a Templar Admiral. He then decides to help some local freedom fighters so that they can fight for freedom and independence. This game doesn't take very long to beat, I've gotten all the upgrades and beat the main story in under six hours, but I didn't explore everywhere that you could go and I didn't do any of the diving areas.

So yeah. I'd recommend this game if you're looking for a short time waster, or want some more Black Flag. I would probably get it on sale though, as $15 for what's basically a DLC is a bit steep. It usually goes on sale for about $4ish dollars though, which is a much better price and definitely worth picking up.",1609291032,1609291032,True,0,0,0,0,True,False,False,False,,,
