79306553,"{'steamid': '76561198036498823', 'num_games_owned': 1354, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 639, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1605600583}",german,"Sicherlich ein gutes Spiel wenn man Black Flag gerade erst gespielt hat und daher die Steuerung kennt und verinnerlicht hat. Meine Spielerfahrung in wenigen ersten Momenten:

Szene Eins: Es ist bei mir schon einige Zeit her, dass ich es gespielt habe und daher kam ich mir etwas unbeholfen vor, als ich in einer Seeschlacht Startete, diese dennoch gewann, aber das Zielschiff versenkte und daraufhin tauchen musste. Beim Tauchen hat mich natÃ¼rlich gleich ein Hai angegriffen und als ich ihm durch auftauchen entkommen wollte, wurde desynchronisiert.

Szene Zwei: Aufgrund dessen war ich wieder an Bord und das gegnerische Schiff (natÃ¼rlich?) wieder auf See und ich konnte es kapern. Wie zieht man noch gleich eine Waffe? Habe ich Ã¼berhaupt eine Waffe? Wie lÃ¤uft man eigentlich und springen muss doch auch eine Taste sein!? Kein Zeitdruck... Die Crew stirbt gerade im Sekundentakt, aber kein Problem, am Ende schaffe ich es beim dritten Versuch.

Szene Drei: ""Oh KapitÃ¤n! Sie verfolgen uns und es sind zu viele!"" Ich fliehe, zerstÃ¶re dabei eines der grÃ¶ÃŸeren Schiffe im Weg, umsegle einen Wirbelsturm um die Gegner abzuhÃ¤ngen und schaffe es mit nur einem hÃ¤rteren Aufschlag durch eine Welle in den Zielbereich. Ich fÃ¼hle mich ein weiteres mal gehetzt wie ein Reh zur Jagdzeit, aber ""Hey, first try!""

Szene Vier: Eine Frau lÃ¤uft vorbei und wird gejagt. Ich checke kurz wie das MenÃ¼ ging, weil ich jetzt wohl eine Waffe habe. Desynchronisiert. Okay, Frau lÃ¤uft, Ich auch, da steht drÃ¼cke LB, ich mache das, nur passiert dadurch nicht viel und ich renne hinter her, bin aber zu spÃ¤t. Desynchronisiert. Ich fummel im MenÃ¼ und checke das es Dartpfeile gab und versuche den Mann damit zu stoppen, aber leider habe ich an dieser Stelle des Spieles keine Dartpfeile. Ich bin jetzt zu weit weg um aufzuholen, Frau stirbt und... Desynchronisiert. Frau rennt, ich renne, bin aber wegen diesem einen Passanten zu langsam und Frau stirbt. Desynchronisiert. Ich renne wie ein Irrer los, bin direkt hinter dem Mann und.. zu langsam fÃ¼r Melee. Desynchronisiert. Ich renne und sehe tÃ¶ten und aus dem Augenwinkel noch irgendwas Ã¼ber Y drÃ¼cken, wÃ¤hrend in dieser Sekunde... Desynchronisiert. Ich seufze und renne und bin gerade noch nah genug dran um den richtigen Button zu drÃ¼cken und... easy! First try, weil ich habe die Steuerung ja intus.
So weit zu meinen ersten 28 Minuten in diesem Spiel.

Tldr - Kein Tutorial und man soll einfach gleich alles kÃ¶nnen. Die Einblendungen fÃ¼r die Steuerung sind viel zu kurz eingeblendet und es lÃ¤uft darauf hinaus, dass man stÃ¤ndig nur desynchronisiert wird und aufgrund des Stress-Faktors in jeder Minute des Anfangs keine Zeit hat sich mit der Steuerung bekannt zu machen.
Wer Black Flag gerade erst gespielt hat oder plant sich beides zu holen, dem wird es sicher SpaÃŸ machen.
Wer das nicht hat, sollte sich aber auf einen harten Spieleinstieg gefasst machen.
Ich will das Spiel damit nicht im ganzen bewerten, was nach 28 Minuten nicht einmal ansatzweise mÃ¶glich wÃ¤re, ich mÃ¶chte nur allen potentiellen KÃ¤ufern diesen Hinweis gegeben haben.
Update:

Nach 10 Stunden kann ich sagen, dass das Spiel an sich SpaÃŸ gemacht hat und eine sinnvolle ErgÃ¤nzung zu AC4 Black Flag ist. Das Ende war dennoch nicht sehr befriedigend und letzt endlich wird es natÃ¼rlich der Geschichte gerecht. Die Sklaven wurden halt nicht durch einen einzelnen Mann befreit.
7.5/10 - Would sneak again",1605446242,1605600799,False,0,0,0,0,True,False,False,False,,,

77537110,"{'steamid': '76561197966970006', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 145, 'playtime_forever': 493, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1603010185}",english,"Freedom Cry is an extra chapter of AC4: Black Flag originally as a DLC to Black Flag is also a stand alone game that brings in just enough new interesting features to make it worth the price. You play as Adewale, Edward Kenway's Ex-First Mate. Most of the game is centered around freeing slaves, and side-missions to do.  The new weapons he gets to use are a nice refreshment though. His main weapons is a machete, and its a brutal weapon that gets the blood flying and the blunderbluss, which adds a whole new element of gameplay, because now you can take out a concentrated group of soldiers with one shot. Overall a good game  and worth the asking price.",1602664781,1602664781,True,0,0,0,0,True,False,False,False,,,

76745508,"{'steamid': '76561198391953814', 'num_games_owned': 100, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 341, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 329, 'last_played': 1610903444}",english,"An honest review from an old fan of the franchise...
Story/Plot/Sypnosis: A simple short story that shows the character development of the legendary Adewale, the quartermaster in Black Flag. No plot twists or so, just a simple liberation story.
Gameplay: Nothing different than Black Flag. Infact I had some performance issues, lots of stuttering for a game that is now so old.
Soundtrack: Suits the game and the environment, nothing special here.

Graphics: Maybe because i played an aged game in 2020 the graphics didnt awestruck me as did Black Flag in 2013. The map is pretty small, locations look the same but for a small map it is just. But imo the map could have been much better.
Play it if ya liked Adewale! I loved him in Black Flag.",1601352668,1601352668,True,0,0,0,0,True,False,False,False,,,

76723162,"{'steamid': '76561198149629305', 'num_games_owned': 176, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 323, 'last_played': 1601314920}",english,"Not worth the $15, but definitely worth buying when on sale if you're into the Assassin's Creed franchise. If not, just buy Black Flag (or any other AC and have fun with it). The story is short but decent, the gameplay is just like every other Assassin's Creed game. Also has a small amount of bugs, but that's not something that would bother you while playing.
Overall, I'd give it a 7.5 outta 10.",1601315225,1601315225,True,7,0,0.62421715259552002,0,True,False,False,False,,,

76601997,"{'steamid': '76561198974671552', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 425, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 425, 'last_played': 1600620485}",english,"AMAZING GAME, but short :(",1601133016,1601133016,True,0,0,0,0,True,False,False,False,,,

76544236,"{'steamid': '76561198170159766', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 257, 'last_played': 1601050440}",english,"A very short and sweet AC experience. I enjoyed this as a nice companion piece to Black Flag. I always did wanted to know what became of Adewale after the events of Black Flag and here I got my answers. This is a very good game, the mission structure is very straight to the point and I appreciate the simplicity of the goals and tasks here. Suiting for not only a DLC, but even for a mainline AC game where I feel like they often try too much with adding too many complex systems for you to juggle.

In here it's like, kill this number of guys to complete the mission. Save this number of slaves to unlock these upgrades. None of that convoluted crap like hunting certain animals yielding certain upgrades found in Black Flag. But yeah Adewale is a serious and devoted member of the Assassin Brotherhood and he is very much like Altair and Connor with his straight forward thinking, just minus all the arrogance and emotionality, but still with just enough naivity for him to learn from even his opponents as to not see the world in black and white.

Speaking of black and white, we should address the not so subtle elephant in the room. I like that this game, much like Liberation, delved into the topic of slavery, but just like that game I don't think it was enough. I am by no means and SJW, and due to those types, it does make it difficult to talk about contentious topics without being branded as one--but I personally think they could have explored the theme a whole lot more in the story instead of making it this straight cut mission to take down the bad guys.

For instance, it was only near the end did they start making an argument on the slavers' behalf for what they do, but it was very Saturday morning cartoon like. While I don't think you can make a logical and reasonable argument FOR slavery, it would have been a beautiful challenge to try. But at the same time I think the final words of the governer kind of encapsulate the Templar philosophy so it's not entirely lost on its theme.

Anyways yeah I recommend this for a quick and concise Assassin's Creed experience, perfect for casuals who don't want to delve too deep into the AC lore and just get a taste of the gameplay without committing too much into the series. But of course this side story is definitely worth it for the long time fans as just another good AC experience as they most often are, flaws and all.

I'd say this game is a little too short, but it IS a DLC so you can't complain too much. Though Adewale's potential character development seems like Edward's in that they both deserved more games continuing their journeys, possibly even converging from time to time.",1601050953,1601050953,True,0,0,0,0,True,False,False,False,,,

76033752,"{'steamid': '76561199069238948', 'num_games_owned': 15, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1502, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 335, 'last_played': 1618022757}",english,coooll,1600197495,1600197495,True,0,0,0.41567528247833252,0,True,True,False,False,,,

75850937,"{'steamid': '76561198061225352', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 325, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 325, 'last_played': 1599917751}",english,"Overall, Freedom Cry is okay. It's not worth the price, however, so I'm glad I got it on sale. You can really see why it's better suited as a DLC.

The gameplay is still the same Assassin's Creed style, but lacks in difficulty, number of areas to explore, not much detail in terms of lore and character development. Freeing the plantations and little side activities were quite entertaining and the new weapons were interesting too.

Visually, it's the same as Black Flag; which is fine because it looks stunning. But, my biggest problem is there's hardly any music in the background when exploring or sailing. Seriously? No shanties? No score? It made the whole experience feel quite empty and boring at times.
Buy it if you're a die-hard fan or want to kill some time for 5 or 6 hours.",1599918083,1599918083,False,9,0,0.595561385154724121,0,True,False,False,False,,,

75026010,"{'steamid': '76561198155312219', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 267, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 267, 'last_played': 1598567097}",english,"Awesome game but, really short. 74855610,"{'steamid': '76561197966870672', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1598035384}",english,"Don't be fooled by what my supposed game time for this game is, I started playing this game as DLC for AC4 and when I was halfway through I found out it was also a standalone game now. I didn't bother going through the whole thing again just to make game time show up.

Ultimately, this game is not worth your time. Play AC4 instead. AdÃ©wale is a better character there. Like AC4, I would summarize that this game has a terribly unlikable story and when it's about to get good - the DLC ends. That's not even a spoiler and I won't go into specifics.

What will you like? More AC4 core mechanics. Do the exploring, swimming, and stealth assassinating. [spoiler]This time, as an actual assassin, contrary to AC4.[/spoiler] Freeing slaves is a fun added mechanic and they shorthanded a lot of character progression, which I felt was good. They introduce some new weapons and new mechanics and moves. At the core, this DLC is more of the same of what you got in AC4 (so play AC4 instead).

So why not? The story is super disappointing. AdÃ©wale is set up to be a fantastic character in AC4 and this DLC ruined him. Although he supposedly has a redemptive 'arch' (more of a sudden 90 degree incline) at the end, the game ended before I could forgive him for being a bad character. Not to mention that the event you think you're working towards never happens (again, I won't say what this all is, in case you do want to play it, but don't - play AC4 instead).

There is one, perhaps, petty beef I have with this game. The final mission has 2 side objectives. I like 100% completing these games, so I was going for it, but I missed one of them, but completed the mission. End credits - 20 minutes of them. Then, I retried, completed both of them and after the mission complete screen shows up - end credits again. I wasn't going to sit through 40 total minutes of credits, so I loaded back to the main menu.... and didn't get the mission completed. You have to watch the credits again if you want your 100%. That... felt like a 0/10 moment and I just quit out the game, knowing deep inside that I did do it.
Honestly, this game is not worth it. Buy AC4. Play that.",1598301256,1598301256,False,5,0,0.503524899482727051,0,True,False,False,False,,,

74535154,"{'steamid': '76561198072021474', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 255, 'last_played': 1597799155}",spanish,"es muy corto, no aporta mucho a la trama, ni tiene grandes desafios. 74474749,"{'steamid': '76561198050591619', 'num_games_owned': 2320, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 453, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 453, 'last_played': 1577681630}",english,"This was a pretty short DLC, but I really enjoyed this one. Itâ€™s really just more Black Flag, but this time playing as AdÃ©walÃ©, Kenwayâ€™s quartermaster from AC4, instead of Edward Kenway. AdÃ©walÃ©â€™s story is pretty great. AdÃ©walÃ© is driven far more by conviction in comparison to Edward, whose motives were mostly fame and fortune. The story itself is, by nature, pretty powerful, as it revolves around slavery, and progression system is almost exclusively tied to freeing slaves and maroons that contribute to your resistance.

The combat in Freedom Cry feels so much better to me than AC4. To me, AC4â€™s combat felt a little floaty. Each strike from Edwardâ€™s sword(s) didnâ€™t really feel like it had much impact. But AdÃ©walÃ©â€™s strikes each feel like they have weight to them, and the NPCs seem to react far better to each strike. Thereâ€™s also some pretty brutal combo finishers that just made combat a blast. For example, AdÃ©walÃ© [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=r1-vtNMM2zw]sweeping an enemyâ€™s feet to topple them over before landing the killing blow[/url], or [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Oyrz06t8hV8]leaving the machete stuck in an enemyâ€™s leg, going for their head, then pulling out the machete[/url].

All that being said, itâ€™s not perfect. I played the standalone version due to the [url=https://forums.ubi.com/showthread.php/1905435-Assassin-s-Creed-IV-Freedom-Cry-Audio-Bug-during-Combat]well-documented sound bugs in the DLC version[/url], but I got it on a pretty decent sale, so I definitely didnâ€™t get shafted by the price difference between the two versions. The [url=https://i.imgur.com/tGrupZn.jpg]mission locking[/url], which forces you to explore an unrelated area of the map is kinda arbitrary since the majority of the DLC takes place in a single settlement, Port-au-Prince.

When I played through AC4, I was a bit displeased with the gameâ€™s draw distance, which was mainly regarding the persistent fog when trying to spot ships with the telescope while out on the ocean, but there were also some issues with NPCs popping/fading in even when youâ€™re extremely close to them. Sadly, thatâ€™s no better in the Freedom Cry DLC. In [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AvLFANzFWmc]this example[/url], you can pretty clearly see NPCs fading in as AdÃ©walÃ© is rounding the trailer of hay.

I also really missed having sea shanties when sailing around in this DLC. Although, I guess it makes sense though, as the crewmen are freed slaves and not pirates. I do have to say, the slave spirituals when taking out the overseers on a plantation were absolutely beautiful, and I only wish they had been just slightly louder so that they were easier to hear.
Finally, [url=https://imgur.com/a/oqFLc5m]hereâ€™s a few 1440p ultrawide screenshots from Assassinâ€™s Creed: Freedom Cry.[/url]
[b]Disclaimer: This review was written in May 2019 and posted in August 2020.[/b]

[b]Disclaimer 2: This was originally played on Uplay before picking it up on Steam in an effort to consolidate my gaming library onto Steam. Steam playtime was idled to match playtime from Uplay.[/b]",1597696602,1604065965,True,7,0,0.606299221515655518,0,True,False,False,False,,,

73337829,"{'steamid': '76561198249766948', 'num_games_owned': 152, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 297, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 256, 'last_played': 1596253589}",english,perfect for history class,1595814609,1595814609,True,0,0,0,0,True,False,False,False,,,

73284758,"{'steamid': '76561198127019306', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1047, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1047, 'last_played': 1595721400}",english,"Assassin's Creed Freedom Cry is, in a very basic understanding, a reskinned extra story about Adewale in his efforts to liberate his brethren from French Slavery.

The game, as a story, leaves you wanting a bit as it tries to fit the Assassin's Creed crescendo approach to story telling into 10 missions that are all relatively short and take place primarily in the lone port. It's not terrible, I just believe had this been a more extended story it would be better.

Typical AC issues run rampant such as: running exactly not where you want to go; jumping to a place that you didn't aim for; surfaces not being sensibly climbable (dude you're a trained assassin and can't jump up to a rock ledge but can superman over onto a tree???); among many others I'm sure I'm missing.

As a short game, gameplay-wise it's pretty good. It's ACIV with a weapon swap to give a different flair to Adewale and it really shows his brutal, emotional approach to literally helping end slavery - kinda makes sense as he is an ex-slave; bravo it isn't a masterpiece rendition but by god for a video game taking on the issue of slavery it's pretty good.
NOW FOR SOME MINOR PROBLEMS; these are just my opinions but I do find them a bit... blah

3... 3 of the weapons are literally just found lying on the ground. The best machete in the game... is literally at a Fort (no spoilers... sorta (: ). A blunderbuss is found on an island. A mid-tier machete is found just lying on an island outside the Maroons Hideout. I like AC power fantasy as much as the next person but if I decided to play another run I would literally ignore freeing slaves and just pick up the actually found weapons of the game. Honestly for the Golden Machete I would rather have a Mayan temple as an homage to the base game (remember this would be a DLC)

About freeing slaves; it definitely is treated as a quota. 2 weapons are unlocked by freeing slaves. A few missions are locked behind freeing an amount or doing a type of freeing slaves; 3 out of 10 I believe. Not the best representation of what a resistance person's motivation would be - ""okay just 30 more and then the Maroons will give me a weapon."" It isn't terrible but it would likely be much better if all missions were locked behind dedication of some kind. Small amounts to not drag out the game but enough that it does feel like you're trying to buy trust with the resistance that you are trying to help.

All in all... This isn't a 20$ game. Maybe it is - but for AC games I'm not feeling it. That said if you truly wanted it or waited for a sale it's a great pickup. Decent recommend no rushing at it though.",1595722226,1595722226,True,1,0,0.523809552192687988,0,True,False,False,False,,,

73224301,"{'steamid': '76561199003915971', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 310, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 310, 'last_played': 1595581947}",english,"tank

73168637,{'steamid': '76561198136914169', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 349, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 349, 'last_played': 1595427381}",english,"If you liked AC4 Black flag and dont have it anymore, this is worth playing if you get it on sale. However, you would be much better off buying the dlc version of this game in black flag if possible as this version is missing a few features such as the sea shanties.

The standalone has very few tutorials and assumes you've already played AC4, it also has poor controller support in my experience. If you haven't played black flag don't bother with this until you've played it.
You can get AC4 black flag on sale for around the same price and it lasted me well over 40 hours at 95% completion. comparatively Freedom cry lasted me about 5 hours at about 80%.

TL;DR Buy AC4 Black flag if you want an assassin's creed game, it has a much better story and you'll have a much better experience. And then if you like black flag, get this as a dlc for it.",1595521813,1595521813,False,26,1,0.722828388214111328,0,True,False,False,False,,,

Im direkten Vergleich kann ich sagen, dass es mir eine Freude war in die Welt der Piraten zurÃ¼ckzukehren. So fand ich Black Flag bisher mit geringen Abstand das bisher beste AC. Die tropische Inselwelt, der Sound, die raue See versprÃ¼hen einfach einen tollen Flair. Edward Kenway war schon ein extrem kurzweiliger Protagonist, in Freedom Cry steuern wir AdÃ©walÃ©, einen ehemaligen Sklaven. Abseits von der schicken Grafik und den spannenden KÃ¤mpfen bleibt Freedom Cry allerdings qualitativ hinter dem tollen Hauptspiel um einiges zurÃ¼ck. 68986777,"{'steamid': '76561198011670131', 'num_games_owned': 412, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 365, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 365, 'last_played': 1589249097}",english,This game is alright. 68622540,"{'steamid': '76561198040629334', 'num_games_owned': 371, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 216, 'last_played': 1588693253}",english,"Was too bored to finish this one. Adewale was ok in Black Flag, but he didnt really do anything until the end of the game when he joins the Assassins. His character doesnt hold his own enough to be a leading man, but i guess it makes sense as this was a DLC for Black Flag rather than a full game.

The game just thrusts you into a mission without telling you anything about Ade, whats happened to him in the 10 or so years since Black Flag or what his mission is. It doesnt really matter as you then get stranded in Haiti and join the slave rebellion there. The templar target is confusing as it seems to be a woman who then becomes an ally. I gave up as the story didnt feel like it was really going anywhere and missions were locked behind how many slaves you freed. You do meet the leader of the slaves but he then takes a backseat and becomes your quatermaster on the Jackdaw, sorry i meant whatever this new ship is called.

Gameplay is the exact same with the exception of weapons, Ade has a machete and a blunderbuss, rather than pistols and swords. The larger world map is the lower south-eastern portion of the west-indies from Black Flag, though its changed a little. Its 10Yrs later so smaller settlements have popped up, Kingston is innaccessable and the town of Port-au-Prince is included where there was formally a hidden cove. Ship gameplay is the same, this time with an new brig that is a carbon copy of the jackdaw. I Didnt explore too much but the best part is the Jackdaw shipwreak, where you dive for the figurehead and Adewale reminices about old times.

The fleet gameplay has gone and been replaced with a similar mechanic to the assassin recruitment from brotherhood, Rev and AC3 except its freed slaves. The problem is that the main town is too small so you free one slave and you end up alerting every guard in the town. Slave freeing activities are mere feet away from one another.",1588693863,1588693863,False,1,0,0.504132270812988281,0,True,False,False,False,,,

64468276,"{'steamid': '76561198119319611', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 173, 'playtime_forever': 306, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 306, 'last_played': 1583263287}",english,"This game is a disgrace to the AC franchise and to Adewale's character. The AI is horrible which makes the game's ridiculously easy. It's very repetitive because every mission is the same: follow some dude or blow up 1 ship. You can explore a few small areas, but they are all the same. I felt nothing for the characters, Ade was very basic and boring and that's not how I remember him. He deserved better than this pathetic excuse for a game. It took around 5 hours to complete, but that's only because you have to do certain repetitive things over and over before the game allows you to continue with the next mission. That certain thing should feel important when you do it, but it didn't, simply because it didn't change anything at all. The plot is also very basic, when it shouldn't be since it's about an important problem from Ade's past. Yet, everything about this game was tedious and flat. The only time it made me feel something was one mission around the end, other than that, I was simply bored. The only good thing is that it looks nice. It's not worth the money or the time.",1583264841,1583524074,False,2,0,0.497228145599365234,0,True,False,False,False,,,

60615337,"{'steamid': '76561198136893525', 'num_games_owned': 304, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 714, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 714, 'last_played': 1577383811}",english,A short but sweet expansion pack with nice variety for the base game of AC: 4 Black Flag where you experience fellow pirate and Assassin AdÃ©walÃ©'s adventures after his mission goes awry from a storm that messes up his plans to recover a Templar Parcel only to return washed ashore confronting his past once again fighting for freedom. New stuff includes a Blunderbuss and his Machete to differ your playstyle as AdÃ©walÃ© is more of a CQB fighter with several new mission types that revolve around rescuing slaves in a decent sized map of Saint Domingue with the usual gameplay variety from the base game for the sea and inland areas all wrapped in AC's signature historical intrigue. 56816325,"{'steamid': '76561198315483653', 'num_games_owned': 184, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 137, 'last_played': 1635485226}",english,"I haven't really been able to play this game as the lag is horrible. I play on a laptop that wasn't made for gaming, so I understand that most games lag on my PC. But this.....this is utter nonsense. I walk at a snails space and run at a slightly slower walk speed. The frame rate is 0 to none and I can't complete any tasks because the reaction time is non-existing. One second I'm perfectly fine and the next I'm almost dead from an attack that wasn't even initiated. The only point that I'm not lagging is when I am in or near water. Which is confusing. The game lags so badly at every point except when I am near the high quality graphics of water. I own other games of the same franchise which do not lag as badly as this one, and they were released after this one, and are thus of a higher graphics quality. Out of all of those, this one is the one that lags? I don't get it. But, aside from that, I do actually recommend this game. The story line seems really good, and I like the diversity and the historical accuracy. I feel like this could have became part of the series, and not been a stand alone. Although I understand why it is.
If I could actually play it, that would be even better.",1573283678,1573283678,True,0,1,0,0,True,False,False,False,,,

55463892,"{'steamid': '76561198052481458', 'num_games_owned': 82, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 262, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1600968740}",italian,"Ammetto di essere stato veramente combattuto sullo spolliciare in alto o in basso e quindi consigliarlo o meno.

La storia, per quanto corta sia (l'ho finito in 2,6 ore di gioco) mi Ã¨ piaciuta. Lottare per gli schiavi, potendoli liberare in diversi modi, sia in mare che in terra Ã¨ molto gratificante, e molti come me che hanno giocato Black Flag, saranno rimasti colpiti dal carattere di Adewale,  poterlo impersonare Ã¨ stato quindi un piacere.
Il costo.

I movimenti qui, sembrano molto piÃ¹ fluidi che in Black Flag, nuova storia, quindi nuova scenografia e battute da scrivere, nuove isole, nuovi personaggi da doppiare, insomma di sicuro avranno messo in moto un bel po di gente sotto compenso. PerÃ², a oggi, nel 2019, Ã¨ venduto al prezzo di 15E, Black Flag e Rogue ne costano 20. Il primo l'ho giocato per 58 ore di divertimento immersivo, in una mappa grande 10 volte tanto, il secondo l'ho giÃ  comprato e lo giocherÃ² finita questa recensione, ma ora ho un po di paura. In oltre, a parte l'ovvia connessione con Black Flag nell'impersonare Adewale, nessun riferimento ad altri AC o alla storia del presente.
I Bug.

E poi i bug.... Ma perchÃ¨?. Io in Black Flag non li ho avuti. Casse di rifornimenti per mare, segnalate nella mappa, ma che in realtÃ  non ci sono, cadaveri che saltellano qua e la, la cerbottana che a volte non spara, lo stesso Ade che soffre di convulsioni muovendosi in piÃ¹ direzioni alla velocitÃ  della luce.

E in ultimo ma il piÃ¹ fastidioso, sebbene nella mappa vengono indicati due nemici vicini, vi capiterÃ  di vederne solo uno, sia con l'occhio dell'aquila che senza. Una volta assassinato quello che vedete, puff!, spunta il secondo e non si sa da dove. Non ho capito se sono sovrapposti e si dividono nell'assassinarne uno, o se appaia dal terreno, sta di fatto che vi salta la copertura.

Per essere chiaro, i bug non sono fissi o perenni, arrivano d'improvviso cosi come spariscono, quello del nemico che compare con un ""puff!"" l'ho avuto solo 2 volte, quello con le casse fantasma per mare, solo 1 volta, ma in relazione a sole 2 ore di gioco, vi sembrerÃ  vi abbiano accompagnato per molto piÃ¹ tempo.
Conclusione.

Venduto come DLC e al giusto prezzo, l'avrei consigliato, ma a queste condizioni proprio non me la sento. Detto ciÃ² fatevi due conti, se vi Ã¨ piaciuto Black Flag e il personaggio di Ade, ve lo consiglio, ma aspettate che sia in offerta, solo per il principio che certi bug, in un DLC di un gioco che non da' problemi, non si dovrebbero pagare.
P.s.

Per quelli intenzionati a commentare che il costo Ã¨ giustificato dal fatto che non Ã¨ un DLC, ma un gioco a se stante, perchÃ¨ lanciabile senza aver installato Black Flag, risparmiatevi, perchÃ¨ anche il meno sveglio capirebbe che Ã¨ stata una semplice manovra commerciale per alzarne il prezzo.",1570296396,1570296949,False,0,0,0,0,True,False,False,False,,,

55369931,"{'steamid': '76561197963501205', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1569881375}",english,Unstable piece of flaming garbage hard froze my PC 4 minutes into the game.,1569881840,1569881857,False,0,0,0.433070838451385498,0,True,False,False,False,,,

55359298,"{'steamid': '76561197970408752', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 1227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 711, 'last_played': 1571519970}",english,"I hate to be writing another negative review but I cannot tell a lie.  I bought this game in the sale along with Syndicate.  I gave that game a thumbs down but this one is worse.

First of all I have played for just one day and am supposedly more than half way through the game.  I expect a good 100 hours out of an Assassin's creed game and this one will be over in less than 40.

Secondly most of the action occurs at sea.  Sure there were some sea sections in Origins but they were reasonably well done. Here you get to take on huge galleons with a tiny little ship.  I guess I'm just pretty rubbish at naval tactics but its pot luck if I win or not.  Adewale is also rubbish at fighting.  I had very little trouble with battles in Syndicate but here I die much more often.

Thirdly there are no side missions to speak of.  There is only the main story.  There are some slave rescuing missions but these are a boring grind.  I did it for several hours to get to 300 slaves rescued so  I could upgrade my machete.  That should make the game easier I thought. But no, this game like many others fell into the poverty trap that the more you upgrade the harder the opponents become so that while you think you are moving forward all the time you are going backwards.
Fourthly, there is no actual stealth mode.  WTF? why make an assassin's creed game that does not have an assassin as its main character.  Miss-selling anyone?

Other annoyances are many: your ship can get stuck in the rocks never to get out again.  I got one bad guy to kill a key holder only to find the keyholder's body disappeared and I could not retrieve the key any more. The back button stops the ship but press it too long and you end up no longer at the helm, not much fun when you are in the middle of a battle.  The list of stupidities are too long to list here.

Overall its a quickly turned out game to capitalise on the success of the Assassin's creed genre; no wonder its always on sale.  Its worth the price of a beer, which is probably what I paid for it but if you want a real game then Origin's is a much better example.",1569878939,1569878939,False,0,1,0.355142384767532349,0,True,False,False,False,,,

54935357,"{'steamid': '76561198045301435', 'num_games_owned': 2017, 'num_reviews': 697, 'playtime_forever': 429, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 429, 'last_played': 1567437146}",english,"This has to be one of my favorite stories, albeit, one of the shortest ones, of the AC franchise. The chance to spread freedom amongst those enslaved is a special kind of reward. I also appreciate the characters are quite believable. Honestly, the only real reason that I don't give this title a 10/10 is because of a few issues.

The main issue that I had here was that this was one of the buggiest AC titles I've played, and for anyone that has played multiple AC titles, they know that that is saying a lot. The combat music would frequently cut in and out with no real reason. The player would frequently get stuck in objects. Combat detection was horrible, and I would frequently find myself sheathing my weapon instead of attacking for no real reason. Then I also had quests that couldn't be totally fulfilled because of NPCs just either not spawning or disappearing randomly.
Overall, I would give this game a 7/10. It's an absolute must play, but be forewarned... it's really buggy.",1567437470,1567437470,True,1,0,0.431623905897140503,0,True,False,False,False,,,

54580692,"{'steamid': '76561198974794517', 'num_games_owned': 8, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 157, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1647199410}",romanian,Nu mi sa dat cd key-ul si nu stiu unde il gasesc am mai platit si 5.99â‚¬,1565606905,1565606905,True,2,1,0.52173912525177002,1,True,False,False,False,,,

54576526,"{'steamid': '76561198053618940', 'num_games_owned': 1023, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 390, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 390, 'last_played': 1565505238}",english,"I have 100% synchronization in both ac4 and this game and ac4 is my favorite AC to date.
Very little progression, you start off as a god at naval combat and can take on the strongest ships in the spanish/french navy as soon as you get your own ship
Buggy as fuck, animations constantly glitch out and parkour is very frustrating due to how unpolished it is, adewale seems to do what ever he wants half the time
Missions are dull and boring as shit, in this ASSASSIN'S CREED game you actually only have one mission where you have to assassinate someone, and that's the very last mission of the game

Map design is absolute shit, the missions and optional objectives encourage stealth yet the map is built with only low rooftops that enemies can see you on along with there being a shit ton of enemies spammed everywhere, liked the stealth in ac4, didnt bother unless i had to in this game

Slave liberation mechanic would've been really cool if it wasnt constantly thrust in your face as the game refuses to shut the fuck up about it despite it being obselete after liberating only a few slave ships (which is made even easier with the lack of progression)
Story is the only interesting part about it, adewale is a likeable character and the story has some interesting beats but is held back by the gameplay
Unless you really want to experience the decent story of this game, just play ac4 instead",1565578352,1565578352,False,3,1,0.523995399475097656,0,True,False,False,False,,,

Leaves two big black bars on your screen. Would probably have liked the game if this was not the case. Refunded,1565539057,1565539057,False,0,0,0.45267486572265625,0,True,False,False,False,,,

54503191,"{'steamid': '76561198048865581', 'num_games_owned': 2546, 'num_reviews': 242, 'playtime_forever': 260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 260, 'last_played': 1565190967}",english,"Depends on what you're looking for, Freedom Cry can either be a perfect bite-sized content dump or a total waste of money.
It took me around 3.5 hours to finish the entire thing with very minor momentary sidesteps into opening chests and synchronizing viewpoints.

The game has 9 missions, mostly with some action sequences, which for me was a breath of fresh air since AC4 almost always had extremely boring missions. Just running and following, while here you have action and sometimes even an open route of doing the mission, which is always welcome. However, don't expect freedom on the level of Watch Dogs 2. In the end you'll do the mission in almost the same way. It's just that you have the choice of picking entry points and what else the level design allows.

The story's just so boring and pointless. It's very low stakes and extremely hollow. It tries to have dramatic story beats, but the sound design and mission design kind of kill whatever the story tries to raise.

Visually, this is AC4 level of graphics, hence why the requirements are the same. However, framerates are around 10% lower (on my GTX 1060 6GB, Ryzen 1400, 16GB 2400MHz RAM). Interiors (the only building you're in) is extremely bare however and remind me more of AC: Liberation HD, with empty room, artificial lighting and the awkwardly placed tables and chairs. Even AC2 had more attention put into it. Considering how half your missions are initiated there, you'd expect some type of quality there.

The sound's pretty scuffed. It's so bad that any citizen/enemy NPC that's more than 20m away will sound extremely echo-y. Not to mention, lowering sound settings seems to completely screw things up. Voice volume at 2/10 will make literally all dialogue sound like extremely distant echoes. Not just quiet, but actual distant echoes with echo effects and all that jazz. There's barely any actual music in this game. In fact, when I lowered my music volume to 2/10, it literally never played, so 50% of my gametime, I heard no melodies. Yet SFX sounds at 2/10 are still pretty loud and obnoxious.
This is amateurish shit. Sound design issues like these don't even occur in beginner Unity games.

The music itself had a goal of having slave worker songs of the time, I'm guessing. So often you'll just hear acapella performance of a single man softly singing in French. I understand the goal, but it's jarring to hear when you snap people's necks.

Adewale's just so boring as well. He has no personality and all he has is ""I follow the creed"" and ""slaves bad"". In the end he has a pretentious talk like ""I've learned so much and I'm old now"", like he accomplished a lot or something. Dude, the entire story took place in the course of a week, at best. This wasn't even a chapter in your life.

Last and not least, the bugs. My lord, they're noticeable. Let's leave out all the audio bugs and instead, let's for example talk about how a piece of paper was glued to my hand for multiple hours or how I kept leaning on a wall, when moving away from it or how I literally just lost my main sword, which at first was invisible, but then was completely removed from my inventory for the rest of the game. I thought it might've been a story thing, but it can't be, since the character uses that weapon so many times in cutscenes. Even with the last boss, you can see him hold it. How can these things even occur?

Overall, Freedom Cry's a mess. But it's also an Assassin's Creed game after Revelations that seems to actually care about your time and doesn't bullshit around too much. There's stuff to do on the side as well, so I think that 100%ing the game could actually take you 10 hours in total or even a bit more. So if you really want to unlock ""Dart pouch II"", then you can easily do that for a while.
I recommend it because I like it personally. But for many it could totally be a thumbs down.",1565193069,1565193081,True,4,0,0.589041054248809814,0,True,False,False,False,,,

52860151,"{'steamid': '76561197977816410', 'num_games_owned': 3533, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 431, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 431, 'last_played': 1561348127}",english,"Although this game was originally available as DLC for Assassin's Creed 4, it felt more like a fleshed out version of what it should have been and, as uncharacteristic as it may be for Ubisoft, they even fixed some bugs in the process (e.g.: machetes didn't make noise??). As for the story itself, there were the usual shortcomings of an Assassin's Creed game but it was mostly competent and it's easy to get emotionally invested in the Maroon's cause. Since this was originally DLC, it sadly shouldn't take too long to complete a playthrough and so it might not be worth getting at full price but I think it's worth picking up while it's on sale.",1561989056,1561989056,True,0,0,0,0,True,False,False,False,,,

50865961,"{'steamid': '76561198035826989', 'num_games_owned': 650, 'num_reviews': 190, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1558885743}",english,"No!
NO!
Very much, no!
Want to play Windowed mode? Have two monitors? This is not the game for you.
Windowed mode doesn't exist, so that's a bad start.
Two monitors? Well, don't have the other one open on a window, it's bloody distracting, because you have to scroll your weapons and it's going to be scrolling that other window like mad!
The Gameplay:
It starts you off in the middle of bugger knows where. With some irksome naval combat. Not played black flag in a while? Well, no tutorial for you, so go play some Black Flag first.
There's checkpoints in the most inconvenient locations. You have to sail through a bloody storm to a location that moves several times while you're sailing to it, and in random directions.
Some tit on your boat keeps shouting something every single time you shoot the enemy, this gets annoying.
Land, no spoilers here, I hate the game, I'm not recommending it, but I won't spoil anything.
You have to find some guy, that's all it says, you'll find yourself doing things while looking for the guy. All this will be undone if that guy sees you. Does it bother telling you that? No.
Seriously. This game is just severely out dated. Clunky, and lacks a certain atmosphere. It feels very quiet and looks very bad.

It might be just that it has aged badly, but in all honesty, Black Flag is still okay to play, this isn't. I recommend giving it a miss, less you can get it cheap.",1558886153,1558886153,False,2,0,0.456023812294006348,0,True,False,False,False,,,

50313191,"{'steamid': '76561198059588553', 'num_games_owned': 212, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 254, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 254, 'last_played': 1515666798}",russian,"ĞŸÑ€Ğ¾Ñ…Ğ¾Ğ¶Ğ´ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ğµ Ğ½Ğ° 100% Ğ·Ğ° 4 Ñ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ¸Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ¹ Ñ‡Ğ°ÑĞ°,Ğ·Ğ° Ñ‚Ğ°ĞºÑƒÑ ÑÑƒĞ¼Ğ¼Ñƒ Ğ±Ñ€Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ½Ğµ ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ğ¸Ñ‚,ÑÑĞ¶ĞµÑ‚ Ğ½Ğµ Ğ¾ÑĞ¾Ğ±Ğ¾ ÑƒĞ²Ğ»ĞµĞºĞ°Ñ‚ĞµĞ»ÑŒĞ½Ñ‹Ğ¹.Ğ¸ Ğº Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ¼Ñƒ Ğ¶Ğµ Ğ·Ğ°Ğ´Ğ°Ğ½Ğ¸Ñ Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ¾Ğ±Ñ€Ğ°Ğ·Ğ½Ñ‹Ğµ",1556182545,1556182545,False,0,0,0,0,True,False,False,False,,,

50294630,"{'steamid': '76561197966316336', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 369, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 369, 'last_played': 1556081177}",english,"AC 4 Black Flag is one of the greatest games ever made, IMO, and I was eager to get to play more of it with this DLC. I enjoyed Black Flag so much that I put off playing this DLC for a long time until I had the time to immerse myself in it to savour it the most.
Unfortunately, this DLC isn't of the same caliber as the main game, and is mostly just a series of doing the same basic, tedious tasks for 4 - 7 hours, depending on how quickly you play it.

This DLC sums up as grinding by liberating slaves, and the small island you spend the most time on is claustrophobically packed with slaves to free to the point that it's entirely unnatural feeling: There are slaves. Free them. Do it again. And again. And again. You already freed hundreds of slaves? No worries, they'll respawn quickly so that you can free the same slaves again, and again, and again.

So, if your interest is going through the experience of seeing and freeing slaves, which I think was the whole point of this DLC, then this game offers that. If you want a creative story, interesting characters, adventure, exploration, something to discover, then skip it and maybe play the main game again or AC Rogue.",1556082261,1556082261,False,0,0,0.361422836780548096,0,True,False,False,False,,,

49657550,"{'steamid': '76561197960526657', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 604, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 586, 'last_played': 1553065756}",english,"I loved going from Black Flag to Freedom Cry -- very seamless transition with same gameplay but less bugs. I'm glad it was a short-but-sweet game. I definitely recommend if you're already an AC fan!",1553064998,1553064998,True,6,0,0.593252599239349365,0,True,False,False,False,,,

49055185,"{'steamid': '76561198025599208', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1550417386}",english,"(only recorded as 5 minutes because I played the DLC through the AC4 dashboard)

I'm  neutral on this one. I love Adewale, but everything that made me like him in AC4 wasn't here for this one. He was single minded, didn't take any risks, didn't have that same pirate flair. The story itself was still engaging though. It felt like a better written version of the Liberation game.

There is a fairly minor but very irritating bug in the AC4 bundle version of this game - there's no audio files for some of Ade's weapons. It woke break the game but its very distracting. 48200603,"{'steamid': '76561198202613939', 'num_games_owned': 458, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 668, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 668, 'last_played': 1547011623}",english,"You'd have to really like AC: Black Flag for this to be a good game. It is pretty short, the side quests all feel empty/contentless, and the combat is quite clunky. Other than the 30 ship plunder Uplay achievement, there is pretty much no reason to engage in ship combat. The style is identical to Black Flag, but the gameplay felt less polished overall. I don't know why this is being sold as a stand alone, everything about it screams short DLC. Other than the very short story, it brings nothing new to the table while taking away quite a lot of content from Black Flag. I bought this for $6 on sale, its regular sale price - it should be about $4.
Also, on behalf of all bitter enders, there is a special place in Hell for developers that make their credits loop.",1547012129,1547013907,False,2,0,0.540636062622070313,0,True,False,False,False,,,

46594742,"{'steamid': '76561198208781583', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 321, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 250, 'last_played': 1580664667}",english,good,1542984462,1542984462,True,0,0,0.460423171520233154,0,True,False,False,False,,,

46508167,"{'steamid': '76561198058159844', 'num_games_owned': 1055, 'num_reviews': 276, 'playtime_forever': 1480, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1480, 'last_played': 1542789628}",english,"The very first mission of [i]Assassinâ€™s Creed IV: Black Flag[/i]â€™s story DLC [i]Freedom Cry[/i] is not only its finest, itâ€™s also an excellent summary of what made the original game good. Weâ€™re tasked with retrieving a package from a Templar admiral aboard his ship. To do this we either board the ship, kill the admiral, and take the package or sink the ship and then dive into the wreckage and retrieve the goods. Giving the player options is what the franchise is supposedly all about, so itâ€™s a shame that the rest of it fails to live up to any of what made [i]Black Flag[/i] fun.

The naval aspect of the game (or as I call it, the fun aspect) has been gutted, with ship upgrades, locations in the world, and variety of activities stripped down to a bare few. Most of [i]Freedom Cry[/i]â€™s gameplay revolves around freeing slaves from plantations, slave ships, and various other slave-related locations. These activities are identical to [i]Black Flag[/i]â€™s equivalents for recruiting new crew members. Raiding a plantation is almost identical to raiding warehouses in the base game, except instead of pickpocketing a key to gain access to the warehouse, we have to kill a prerequisite amount of guards to allow the slaves to escape. Stealth is still encouraged, as overseers will start slaughtering slaves if you raise the alarm, reducing the rewards you get for success.

Which leads me into a minor quibble that seems fundamentally bizarre. For a game thatâ€™s all about the moral injustice of slavery, [i]Freedom Cry[/i] turns all the slaves into a number even after youâ€™ve rescued them. Doing poorly in any side activity leads to slaves dying, which means less rewards for you. The only time it really touches on the horrors of slavery in more than a token way is a mission towards the end in which you have to free as many slaves from a sinking slave ship as possible. The plot turns the lead up to the Haitian Revolution from a seething pit of atrocities and injustice to the franchiseâ€™s signature â€œletâ€™s rebel against the evil people because theyâ€™re evil in a Saturday-morning cartoon villain kind of wayâ€. Never has this franchise simultaneously mishandled both the actual gameplay and the historical context in such a spectacular fashion.

This is a shame, because AdÃ©walÃ© - your quartermaster in [i]Black Flag[/i] and the lead character of [i]Freedom Cry[/i] - was a genuinely good character in the base game. He was a strong, principled man who juxtaposed well with the selfish aims of piracy and the other characters who practiced it. [i]Freedom Cry[/i] seemed to promise some sort of expansion of his character, but without the foil that was Kenway (and by extension the entire theme of piracy), heâ€™s turned into the same dogmatic, bland hero-type that Ubisoft always comes up with. The way his story wraps up in [i]Rogue[/i] is kind of nice, but Ubisoftâ€™s writers donâ€™t understand that recapturing the appeal of the Ezio arc of [i]II[/i], [i]Brotherhood[/i], and [i]Revelations[/i] requires more than just having multiple appearances; you have to play to the charactersâ€™ strengths and how they reflect the era they live in. But, as usual, both the story and the game itself turned out to be a massive disappointment.",1542946302,1542946302,False,8,1,0.561728060245513916,3,True,False,False,False,,,

46314150,"{'steamid': '76561198082231892', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 410, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1543236679}",english,"10/10

Black Flag was the last good thing in the AC Franchise. Glad it's DLC doesn't disappoint. Adewale is an extremely respectable character who deserved some spotlight, and Freedom Cry is perfect. It gives just the right amount of importance to him. Not too much, not too little. Takes him out of the shadow of Captain Edward Kenway yet doesn't overshadow Kenway's awesomeness. This is called proper character development. Perfectly balanced. As all things should be.

Hopefully Ubi will stop making more AC games. End it for God's sake. Stop milking the AC cow, it's on the brink of death.",1542895340,1670329496,True,0,2,0.47442549467086792,0,False,True,False,False,,,

46305463,"{'steamid': '76561198029972608', 'num_games_owned': 654, 'num_reviews': 406, 'playtime_forever': 479, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 479, 'last_played': 1543002112}",english,"[b]PROS:[/b]
+ decent story
+ pretty visuals and environment
+ nice soundtrack
+ more strength based combat
[b]CONS:[/b]
- uPlay
- couple of ship/NPC spawn glitches
- many unskippable cutscenes
- really short story
- repetitive slave-freeing missions
[b]Special review section for Ubisoft games:[/b]
[u]Should you play?[/u] YES, IN AC4
[u]Should you BUY???[/u] NOPE
[b]Comment:[/b]

We get to experience a bit of life of AdÃ©walÃ© (our quartermaster for most of AC IV Black Flag) and his fight against slavery. I was hoping for a real expansion where we would get to know AdÃ©walÃ© from his beginnings, how he got the scars and ended up on the ship where he met Edward Kenway. Then a shift to some missions while Kenway did his stuff. And AFTER that sequences of what became of AdÃ©walÃ©. Here you just get the last part and even that is really vague in story telling. The campaign is rather short and consists mostly of just freeing slaves in rather repetitive scenarios that just respawn in the same place (runaway, injured, punishment, auctions, jail, plantation, slaver ship). Still, I liked getting to know at least a bit more about him. The gameplay feels more brutal as he is strength based which translates into impactful hits with the machete or the blunderbuss (which is basically a big shotgun). If they fully fleshed it out as an expansion (like AC Liberation HD or AC Rogue) we could have gotten more story and action. And it would feel different because AdÃ©walÃ© seems less stealthy and more tanky. You kind of see the wasted potential. Coupled with some weird AI glitches you see how rushed this game was. For example slave auctions I can murder the auctioneer and often the other slavers just watch and wait until I kill them too. If you have AC IV Black Flag this content is available as DLC. There is no need for this standalone version, it doesn't have enough content to call it an expansion. AC IV Black Flag is a really great game that ships with this as DLC so buy it there through Season Pass for the best value-for-money ratio.
[b]P.S.:[/b] To activate, the CD-key Steam shows you, go to uPlay and then to Activate a key.

[b]If you liked this review you can find more on the [/b][url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/28638055-Subjective-Reviews-Corner/][u]Curator page[/u][/url][b] or in my [/b][url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/srcorner][u]Review Corner[/u][/url][b].[/b]",1542893946,1665486615,False,5,0,0.517045438289642334,0,True,False,False,False,,,

44551057,"{'steamid': '76561198055316201', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 461, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 461, 'last_played': 1535987502}",english,"I have one major problem wwith this game but I'll get to it.
Pros:
- Awesome premise
- Sequence 8
- See what happened to the Jackdaw
Cons:
- Extremely repetitive
- Almost non-existant soundtrack
- No sea shanties (Thought that would've been a no-brainer)
- Sailing simply feels worse and sluggish
- 1/2 the ""locations"" are literal 20m stretches of sand with 1 chest
- Glitches and bugs on numerous occasions
- Combat engine is a joke or simply unfinished
- Adewale's Character

My biggest issue with this game is they took Adewale in Black Flag, an amazing charcter in his own right and ground all his unique traits into dust. His only motivation to help the people is essentially because they're slaves and ""It's what he should do."" with the game subtly suggesting ""What is wrong with you if that isn't enough motivation? Do you like slavery?"" which in itself should be enough motivation, but because of the repetition, it just doesn't feel like enough.

A sequence that stands out for me is in Black Flag, is in sequence 11, Adewale wakes kenway up after his nightmares with a bit of wit and busting his balls for being an idiot. Throughout all of Black Flag Adewale is painted as a stoic realist but with a wit and character that's more than meets the eye and in this game all of that is gone. He's just doing this because it's the right thing to do and all his humour and charcter has just disappeared.

I understand that the situation is grim and Ubisoft could have explained that over the years his character changed due to the world around him but there's just no explanation. It's simply, ""he's like this now, deal with it."" It feels like they couldn't be asked and just made the character into a broad, easily digestible protagonist with none of the charm that came across in Black Flag.
I love Adeale's charcter (in Black Flag at least) and look forward to the game that allows me to play as that character, but this, just isn't it.

42802333,"{'steamid': '76561198158905982', 'num_games_owned': 10694, 'num_reviews': 306, 'playtime_forever': 198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 198, 'last_played': 1529291587}",spanish,"Si de por si te cagaban a corchasos por ser pirata, imaginate si tambien sos negro!
Nos metemos en las transpiradas cachas de un tipo de color ""Adewale"" que que quiere
liberar a su raza que es obviamente esclavisada para poder ser estudiada por los blancos
asi sacar provecho y mejorar sus vidas.
Este debe ser el primer DLC copado de la saga que vale la pena comprar, este pata sucia ademas
de ser el gameplay igual al del IV,  le mete cositas copadas al barco, un machete con el que se
faja a todo el mundo y una escopeta que te deja como un colador.
Nos la pasaremos navegando y liberando Negros de personas que solo quieren hacer su vida mas facil!
No se puede pedir mas, capaz un DLC donde podamos matar negros y no a los nuestros.

42648240,{'steamid': '76561198356455319', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 595, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 594, 'last_played': 1595120891}",english,"Well first things first, it was never going to be a huge game, because it was originally DLC. That is probably why all up it took me around 3 and a half hours to complete. But it was fun. It was different to your usual Assassins Creed game, focusing on Adewale trying to free black people from being slaves, and I guess one of the most painful looking boss deaths ever. 42500942,{'steamid': '76561197982168359', 'num_games_owned': 466, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 330, 'last_played': 1516573272}",english,fun i wish there was more of a story though,1528165839,1528165839,True,2,1,0.520229876041412354,0,True,False,False,False,,,

42488244,"{'steamid': '76561198325261156', 'num_games_owned': 90, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 216, 'last_played': 1527849808}",english,"Assassin's Creed Freedom Cry was an ok game.

It is a filler for the previous Assassin's Creed - Black Flag where you play as one of the characters. Story wasn't as interesting as the Black Flags and not as long either. Finished the story within 3 hours of gameplay.

Everything is pretty much the same as the previous game was except you'll have new item to use which are fire crackers. Otherwise you'll have a ship and can do ship battles and so on. Another thing that was different was the way you can upgrade your gear. To do so you will have to save slaves. The more slaves you have saved the better gear you'll own.

I experienced few graphical glitches here and there - such as going in the building and it started raining in side while it was sunny outdoors or when jumped off ship on the bridge random water splash appeared around me. Nothing too serious tho.
You could simply skip this game and move on to the next one - but if you don't really mind it being short then go for it.

42327004,"{'steamid': '76561198271741179', 'num_games_owned': 77, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 527, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 454, 'last_played': 1527472658}",schinese,"é˜¿è‚²å²ä½æ´»åŠ¨è´­å…¥ï¼Œå‰§æƒ…å¾ˆçŸ­ï¼Œå¦‚æœèƒ½å»¶ä¼¸åˆ°æµ·åœ°äººæ°‘è§£æ”¾çš„è¿‡ç¨‹å°±å¥½äº†ã€‚ç”·ä¸»è§’å››è‚¢å¼ºå£®ï¼Œå¤´è„‘å‘è¾¾ã€‚å¯æƒœä¸€ä¸ªDlcä¹Ÿè¦æ‹¿å‡ºæ¥å–è¿™æ ·å¥½å—ï¼Ÿ

42320910,"{'steamid': '76561198391694501', 'num_games_owned': 60, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 370, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 171, 'last_played': 1527295920}",english,"Starting off, I would definitely recommend playing this game with a controller. It is possible to play with mouse and keyboard, but I found myself having to remap keys and it was just less hassle and more comfortable for me to play on a controller. I would highly recommend this game to anyone thinking about buying it. I greatly enjoyed the familiar flow of the game mechanics from Assassin's Creed IV: Black Flag, which is very intuitive and easy to grasp the concept of. I felt these characteristics were most visible in the areas of combat and parkour, as the mechanics and handling were quite simple and manage to make the gameplay flow easily and comfortably as I played. The storylines were decent and I felt as though the entire storyline came to a bit of a rough but respectable conclusion. This may have something to do with my thinking that the game would have been longer than it was, seeing as how I managed to knock out the main storyline (plus a few minor activities) in about 6 hours. Which leads me to some of the downsides. The game itself, in my opinion, had so much more potential to tell more of Adawale's backstory or add more missions with Adawale, leaving much to be desired. Moving on to the weapons system, or lack there of, seeing as how your choice of meelee weapons is only your hidden blades, fists, and a Rusty Machete to start out the game with. To unlock the only other weapon in the game (the Steel Forged Machete), you must liberate a certain amount of slaves, as you have to do to unlock other upgrades/gear. I felt as though the liberation numbers for the weapons are a bit to high, guiding the player to start out the game with a mediocre machete and then near the very end of the game all of a sudden get this way cooler, better machete, making it feel a little late to the party. But again, this could be attributed to the fact that the whole game started as DLC and then turned into a standalone game, so I guess I can't hate on the game too much for that. But overall, I felt that the game itself was a solid work with plenty of activities/sidequests to look forward to after completing the main storyline, and I would highly encourage anyone who is looking to aquire this game to do just that.",1527452101,1527452101,True,0,0,0,0,True,False,False,False,,,

41989062,"{'steamid': '76561198085367707', 'num_games_owned': 779, 'num_reviews': 372, 'playtime_forever': 727, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 727, 'last_played': 1523413657}",brazilian,"Assassin's Creed Freedon Cry mantÃ©m a boa jogabilidade do jogo base, mas apresenta um protagonista bem mais interessante e com objetivos alinhados com o espÃ­rito original da franquia. O tÃ­tulo Ã© um Standalone, ou seja, uma expansÃ£o que nÃ£o precisa do jogo original para ser jogada, mas, em se tratando de uma DLC, Ã© natural que traga conteÃºdo mais modesto.

Apesar de curta, a histÃ³ria Ã© boa e se passa alguns anos apÃ³s os acontecimentos de Black Flag, quando o navio de AdewalÃ© (o antigo contramestre do Kenway) naufraga e ele acaba ficando preso em Porto PrÃ­ncipe.

Ocorre que, enquanto buscava uma maneira de sair da cidade, AdewalÃ© se envolve na luta para quebrar as correntes da escravidÃ£o, passando entÃ£o a ajudar os membros da resistÃªncia, formada por escravos fugidos ou libertos de toda a regiÃ£o.

Apesar de ser um tema sensÃ­vel, a crueldade da escravidÃ£o Ã© bem retratada durante a campanha e tambÃ©m na ambientaÃ§Ã£o do jogo, jÃ¡ que, a todo o momento, Ã© possÃ­vel presenciar pessoas negr4s sendo vendidas em leilÃµes, trabalhadores humilhados por baixo rendimento no serviÃ§o, ou atÃ© sendo aÃ§oitados por qualquer que seja o motivo.

HÃ¡ vÃ¡rios momentos do jogo, em que precisaremos libertar escravos para que eles se juntem a nossa causa, mas mesmo que nÃ£o fosse o caso, vocÃª se sente praticamente obrigado a salvar alguÃ©m que esteja sendo chicoteado em praÃ§a pÃºblica. SÃ£o vÃ¡rias as formas de libertaÃ§Ã£o, seja individualmente, salvando alguÃ©m preso em uma jaula, ou ainda em grandes grupos de uma vez, interceptando navios negreiros.

O chato Ã© que mesmo nos momentos finais, apÃ³s jÃ¡ ter libertados todos os escravos para a resistÃªncia, eles continuam aos montes pela cidade como se fossem infinitos e toda a sua luta contra a escravidÃ£o nÃ£o tivesse servido de nada. O ideal seria que as forÃ§as escravistas perdessem terreno com o avanÃ§o da campanha, o que nÃ£o acontece.

Para alÃ©m do cenÃ¡rio de fundo, o jogo nÃ£o possui mudanÃ§as em relaÃ§Ã£o ao jogo base. AliÃ¡s, nota-se que atÃ© a movimentaÃ§Ã£o do AdewalÃ© Ã© idÃªntica Ã  do Kenway, a despeito de seus diferentes tipos fÃ­sicos, sendo que apenas armas Ã© que foram trocadas, vez que as espadas deram lugar a um imenso facÃ£o.

O mapa foi bastante reduzido, e embora ainda conte com uma grande Ã¡rea a ser navegada, nÃ£o hÃ¡ nada de realmente interessante lÃ¡ para ser descoberto. AtÃ© os fortes que encontramos nas encostas das praias nÃ£o precisam ser explorados, vez que jÃ¡ foram destruÃ­dos pelo Gralha durante a campanha do jogo principal, restando apenas descer do navio para saquear o baÃº que sempre estarÃ¡ Ã  beirada da praia.

Porto PrÃ­ncipe Ã© interessante, mas Ã© apenas um pequeno vilarejo. Temos um navio para aprimorar, mas nÃ£o na mesma escala, e assim por diante. Todos estes fatores nos contam que Freedon Cry Ã© essencialmente uma versÃ£o simplificada do mesmo jogo apresentado no lanÃ§amento do jogo base, o que nÃ£o Ã© necessariamente ruim.

Resumidamente, Freedon Cry Ã© sem dÃºvidas uma bela expansÃ£o, que apesar de nÃ£o trazer nada de novo em termos de jogabilidade, tem uma excelente narrativa, que Ã© inclusive bem mais interessante que a do tÃ­tulo principal. Ã‰ certamente um prato cheio para os fÃ£s da sÃ©rie. MUITO BOM (8/10).",1526090850,1609804343,True,12,0,0.676803767681121826,1,True,False,False,False,,,

41290575,"{'steamid': '76561198019219205', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 810, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 775, 'last_played': 1522894243}",english,"I had not heard very good things about this game, which is the reason why I waited so long to add it to my collection. When the right price came along, I took a chance because, hey, it's still an Assassin's Creed game!

After playing through the game, fairly quickly I might add, I am sorry to say that the game was everything the negative reviews said it was. Yes, it is very short, but I also realize it was originally designed to be a DLC pack for Black Flag, so I'm willing to overlook that one. However, the game gets extremely repetitive in a very short time. It's basically going from one liberation mini-game to another. Once I maxed out the number of liberated slaves to get all of the add-ons, there really was no point in liberating any more slaves and I found myself looking the other way when I came across another liberation mini-game.

Second, if you have played Black Flag or Rogue and have any amount of skill in the naval missions, you will quickly dominate on the seas in this game and max out your ship very early on. As you can imagine, it makes the naval battles incredibly easy and a lot less fun.

If you are looking to complete your Assassin's Creed collection and can get this game for the right price, you may still consider buying it. The story is still entertaining, despite how short it is. But, for the reasons I already discussed, I could not recommend buying this game.",1522894845,1522894845,False,12,1,0.610773444175720215,0,True,False,False,False,,,

41241465,"{'steamid': '76561198168340656', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 253, 'last_played': 1555905506}",spanish,"Muy buen juego, a veces un poco estresante en eso de las misiones pero lo recomiendo totalmente para las personas que quieran seguir una aventura en concreto.",1522724303,1522724303,True,0,0,0.476190477609634399,0,True,False,False,False,,,

41093888,"{'steamid': '76561198063115240', 'num_games_owned': 2836, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 3125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3125, 'last_played': 1497738272}",english,"Another Assassin's Creed game, here we're following up with Adewale's story after he decided to join the Assassins in Assassin's Creed IV: Black Flag.
Graphics are great, same as Black Flag, soundtrack is also good. But the story is uninteresting to say the least. Also, there's no major progress in the present day story.
We understand that Adewale is on a mission for the Assassins Order but he decides to postpone that in order to end the slavery with machetes and blunderbusses.
This whole game feels like one big assassination mission. Find your target, try to make him vulnerable, assassinate him. But don't forget the side quests and those collectibles.
I wouldn't recommend this game  unless you're a big fan of the Assassin's Creed series.",1522183570,1584139258,False,24,22,0.544768631458282471,2,True,False,False,False,,,

39189449,"{'steamid': '76561198054082414', 'num_games_owned': 499, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 475, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 475, 'last_played': 1449023382}",english,I don't like Assasin's Creed but I bought this during a sale and thought why not. 39179165,"{'steamid': '76561198007299088', 'num_games_owned': 315, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 272, 'last_played': 1515400290}",german,"Assassin's Creed Freedom Cry ist, wie viele schon sagen, Black Flag im Kleinformat. Die guten Spielmechaniken, sowie die gute Grafik wurden Ã¼bernommen, auch der Protagonist (der wie ich finde ziemlich nervtÃ¶tend ist) ist aus Blag Flag bekannt. Wenn man aber mal von Mechanik und Grafik absieht, ist es meiner Meinung nach das schlechteste Assassin's Creed bis jetzt. Die Handlung ist Ã¼berhaupt nicht spannend, man wird zu langweiligen Nebenmissionen gezwungen, um die Hauptstory weiter spielen zu kÃ¶nnen, die nur ~10 Missionen lang ist und sich locker in fÃ¼nf Stunden durchspielen lÃ¤sst. Zum GlÃ¼ck. Die einzig gute Neuerung ist die DonnerbÃ¼chse, die eine schÃ¶ne Abwechslung zu den anderen Waffen bietet. Das wars aber auch schon.

Insgesamt lÃ¤sst sich sagen, dass dieses Spiel nichts bietet, was es spielenswert machen kÃ¶nnte. Wenn man es sich wirklich mal anschauen will, dann bitte nur im Sale kaufen.",1515411686,1515411720,False,4,0,0.522816181182861328,1,True,False,False,False,,,

39109804,"{'steamid': '76561198187835859', 'num_games_owned': 245, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 788, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 672, 'last_played': 1551469827}",english,"Save yourself sometime and don't buy this. I'm not usually harsh on a game but this one time I have to be because:
1) It's exactly like black flag
2) It's buggy unlike black flag
3) It has an antagonist you don't really care about
and finally
4) if you have money to buy this, buy Black flag instead.

Look, the amount of enemies is bullshit. Sure, when you are not doing a mission it is quite fun (on a high specs PC because a low specs PC will lag   H E A P S  ) killing dudes in large battles. You couldn't accomplish that in black flag. However, during a mission IT IS LITERALLY IMPOSSIBLE TO STAY HIDDEN. I HAD TO REDO ALL THE MISSIONS AT LEAST 5 TIMES TO NOT DIE.
But if you really want this, do yourself and buy it as DLC, not the standalone. It also doesn't come with a tutorial, so people coming from console like I did, beware.
Edit:
I just want to add two things because I feel like I went a little hard on this game.
1) The world is beautiful. I managed to get several screenshots of the moon rising over a island while I was taking a ship which was amazing.

2) The tight nature of the map, which I already stated I don't like because missions, can also make things quite satisfying and/or even more breath taking. I boarded a ship in the middle of a british/spanish battle full of brigs, man'o'wars and frigets and my god I almost died looking at the battle around me.

However, I still don't recommend this game. A few breath taking and amazing moments cannot compensate with how frustrating the game actually is.",1515224101,1515434531,False,5,1,0.522163629531860352,1,True,False,False,False,,,

38796667,"{'steamid': '76561198115669348', 'num_games_owned': 580, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1520752516}",russian,"Ğ“Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ½Ğ¾Ğµ Ğ´Ğ»Ñ, Ğ¶Ğ°Ğ»ÑŒ Ñ€Ğ°Ğ·Ğ²Ğµ Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¾ ĞºĞ¾Ñ€Ğ¾Ñ‚ĞºĞ¾Ğµ :)",1514498721,1514498721,True,5,1,0.572561860084533691,0,False,False,False,False,,,

38791888,"{'steamid': '76561198190380543', 'num_games_owned': 613, 'num_reviews': 603, 'playtime_forever': 582, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 582, 'last_played': 1514489966}",english,"Assassin's Creed Freedom Cry offers a trimmed down experience of what Assassin's Creed IV: Black Flag offers. While its core mechanics are the same, exploration and progression are way more limited. It serves mainly as a way to tell a short story with AdÃ©walÃ©, one major NPC in Black Flag. And while it isn't great, the focus on slavery is refreshing and interesting. One particular mission managed to shock me a bit, which is a good accomplishment. As an epilogue to Black Flag, it's actually decent.

Then why am i giving a negative rating? Price. There's 2 major problems in my view: 1 - If you haven't played Black Flag before, you can get that full game for just a little more, which has way, way more content; 2 - If you have finished Black Flag and want more of the same experience, you can get Freedom Cry as DLC for less money. Also, for just a little more, you can get Assassin's Creed Rogue, which is a full game that also uses the same mechanics as Black Flag, but in a different setting. Both of these options offer way more value. That's why i don't recommend to get Freedom Cry as a standalone game. It's overpriced.",1514489446,1514489446,False,19,1,0.66520613431930542,0,True,False,False,False,,,

36995933,"{'steamid': '76561198142571930', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 307, 'last_played': 1511427943}",spanish,"Una versiÃ³n mini del Assassins Creed Black Flag, originalmente un DLC de este, separado en una versiÃ³n individual que no necesita el juego original; la cual esta algo mas optimizada y se siente mas refrescante que el Black Flag al no ser los movimientos reciclados y que las armas principales tanto cuerpo a cuerpo como a distancia sean distintas y esto le de un set de movimientos distinto al personaje.

Los eventos en el mapa tienen una finalidad que es la de desbloquear mejoras para el personaje y el barco, el explorar el mapa te da recompensas inmediatas como es armas nuevas, los cofres dan mas dinero que en su predecesor lo cual es de agradecer y hay menos coleccionables que en el Black Flag lo cual tambien se agradece.

No merece la pena por el precio que tiene tanto como DLC como juego separado ya que de historia tendra alrededor de 2-3 horas, pero si lo encuentras en oferta entonces si que merece la pena ya que es mas dinamico que su predecesor.",1511429674,1511429674,True,9,0,0.632925510406494141,0,True,False,False,False,,,

35529364,"{'steamid': '76561197969481463', 'num_games_owned': 2019, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 723, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 572, 'last_played': 1507329922}",english,"Buy only if you've already played Assassin's Creed IV and want a little more. And then I still would only recommend this on sale. It's very short. I was able to 100% this game in about 12 hrs. I probably could have done the main story missions in half that. In my time playing I did crash twice, but the checkpoint system is very generous, I was able to start up again during the mission after my last checkpoint only seconds before the crash happened.

Anyways, this is a nugget sized piece of Black Flag, only with a slave freeing side activity. You get a small area to sail around in and get into ship battles. Little islands to find chests in. There is harpooning but only for materials to sell. Instead of fortresses, you've got plantations where you have to kill guards to free slaves. There is 1 main city where you can go around freeing slaves being punished, incarcerated in cages, being transported, or just lying in the ground hurt. The combat is basically the same as part 4.

The story is OK, nothing great but neither are most AC games. I played AC IV back when it first came out on the 360 and really enjoyed it so going back to it for a little bit was very fun. Buy Assassin's Creed IV instead if you have a choice, otherwise this is a fine little extra.",1507330780,1507330780,True,26,3,0.770829916000366211,0,True,False,False,False,,,
