34767077,"{'steamid': '76561198108652055', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 209, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1504657995}",english,"One of the worst AAA titles Ive ever played. First off, the story is boring. The gameplay is boring. All of your actions feel like your hand is being held. They shouldve just sent the devs over to push the buttons for me. And even though every single action is being prompted to you, they do nothing to tell you how or why you should use certain features.

I reinstalled to revisit this game. I had it form the beginning. I played for 30 mins and never went back. So, I thought maybe I was being unfair. Im not. And the only reason why this has good reviews is because the cinematics are fine and there is a loyal fanbase that only upvotes things because it is AC. Thats it. I've had a long and detailed discsussion about this with a few of them. In the end - after a long long time of denying their bias - they finally just said ""well I like AC so I can look past the fact its almost totally flawed"". To date not a  single one  has been able to make a Pro vs Con list where the cons are less numerous than the positive points.
Also, uPlay FTH (for the headache)!",1504658349,1504658349,False,12,2,0.355258464813232422,9,True,False,False,False,,,

33403791,"{'steamid': '76561198360572103', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 187, 'last_played': 1499027478}",swedish,j,1499606117,1499606117,False,0,0,0.423432022333145142,0,True,True,False,False,,,

33339848,"{'steamid': '76561198013325883', 'num_games_owned': 1018, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 913, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 913, 'last_played': 1499391421}",english,"Assassin's Creed Freedom Cry is a great addition to the franchise. It rises where Black Flag falls. Story.  It's still a very very short story but there are touching storyline, characters you care,  and the game just feels like you are actually in the slavery era, and the amazing music, side quests and atmosphere strengthens this situation. Adewale is a strong main character. We saw him in Black Flag, but we never knew the characters backstory, or the connection to Assassin's. The map is also really big , especially in a short game like this, there are lots of secrets to discover, treasures to find. And awesome side activities like diving or harpooning big sea animals still here, and still fun as hell. Liberating slaves are fun. But gets boring and repititve really fast. The great mix of stealth and blunt combat is great, machete is also very satisfactory weapon. Ship and Adewale upgrades gradually increases the gametime for completionists like me. Its overall great fun for all Assassins Creed lovers.
[h1] Pros:	[/h1]
+ Great graphics and atmosphere
+ Lots of side activities and unlockables
+ Big map, lots of places to travel
+ Great and fitting soundtracks
+ Very good story
+ Great combat, personally the best in the series
+ Lots of weapons, side weapons and fun items
[h1] Cons:	[/h1]
- Abysmally short story
- No alternate outfits
- Lots of bugs

33311542,"{'steamid': '76561198078120032', 'num_games_owned': 47, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 593, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 473, 'last_played': 1661595270}",spanish,"Que no os confundan, esto no es un juego, es un DLC, solo que a diferencia de las consolas que se vendia como DLC, aqui lo venden como juego.

Por lo demas, es un juego con buena historia, te hace ser nostalgico en ocasiones si jugastes al Black Flag, las mecanicas son las mismas y aÃ±ade mucho sentimiento a todo lo que realizas.

Questo DLC.... non Ã¨ proprio malvagio
Certo porta parecchie pecche se confrontato al gioco base, ma tutto sommato Ã¨ sulla norma.
[h1]PRO[/h1]
[b]Protagonista[/b]: Uno dei pregi che ho apprezzato tanto di questo dlc stand-alone Ã¨ il nostro Protagonista: AdÃ©walÃ©.
Esatto il nostromo del gioco base che accompagna sempre il nostro Edward Ã¨ il protagonista di questo DLC, e sinceramente tiene un carisma che mi Ã¨ piaciuto tanto.

Durante il gioco ci son state diverse decisioni da lui prese che mi sono piaciute un sacco. Non intendo il classico ""Salva gli schiavi dall'uomo bianco"", pure quello c'Ã¨, ma sono ben altre le azioni che mi son piaciute.
[h1]NEUTRO[/h1]
[b]Trama[/b]: La trama ha qualche similitudine con quella di ""Assassin's creed Liberation"", ossia salvare gli schiavi.
Avevo giudicato la trama negativa li, piÃ¹ che altro per come veniva raccontata, con tanti buchi narrativi, scene che sembravano tagliate, e situazioni svolte in maniere inverosimili.

Qua invece Ã¨ molto Ben raccontata, con un personaggio secondario che ho apprezzato parecchio, e con situazioni che hanno delle consequenze piÃ¹ verosimili (esattamente come doveva essere Assassin's creed Liberation""). Purtroppo c'Ã¨ da dire che a livello narrativo rimane sempre scarso, e di 3 ore di gioco solo qualche sequenza mi Ã¨ piaciuta particolarmente
[b]Spingarda[/b]: Una delle poche novitÃ  rispetto al gioco di base Ã¨ quest'arma.
Un fucile a pallettoni dove Ã¨ possibile uccidere numerosi avversari vicini.
PerchÃ¨ la metto nei contro? in molte situazioni sarÃ  uno svantaggio visto che ucciderete pure dei passanti (e quindi verrete di sincronizzati fallendo la missione).
[b]LongevitÃ [/b]: Il dlc in questione dura 3 ore.

Per un dlc diciamo che Ã¨ sulla norma alla fine, avrei preferito magari qualcosina di piÃ¹ di trama (visto che per via delle attivitÃ  secondarie avremo 1 ora e mezza di trama) ma alla fine Ã¨ ""ok"".
[h1]CONTRO[/h1]
[b]AttivitÃ  secondarie[/b]: Esse sono un altra novitÃ  del gioco.
Si tratterÃ  semplicemente di liberare gli schiavi in diversi modi tipo uccidere quelli che li vendono all'asta, quelli che li rincorrono, quelli che li puniscono, una vera strage dei uomini bianchi.
Il problema e che dopo neanche un quarto d'ora vi annoierete giÃ  subito, e saranno obbligatorie durante il gioco.
[b]Il machete[/b]: Come arma Ã¨ veramente debole, ma tanto debole, a pugni forse si riesce a fare piÃ¹ danno.

Ci sono molte sezioni di combattimento dove ho provata ad usarla, e dopo 5 colpi di machete vedevo l'avversario ancora vivo. Fortunatamente avremo la nostra lama celata, che infatti farÃ  piÃ¹ danno rispetto a quel machete che ci hanno piazzato.
[b]Ambientazione[/b]: L'ambientazione di Assassin's Creed IV l'ho adorato tantissimo, e quindi pure qua mi Ã¨ piaciuta ugualmente, solo che Ã¨ veramente troppo troppo simile al gioco base.
Mi sarei aspettato qualche zona diversa, invece sarÃ  un copia incolla con dimensione ridotta.
[b]Bug Grafici[/b] a non finire come il gioco di base (durante una sezione di nave un mio marinaio si Ã¨ catapultato nel cielo piÃ¹ veloce del ""Team Rocket"").
[b]Mancanza di un tutorial nelle battaglie navali[/b]: Seppur meno sfruttate ci sono sempre, e in qualche sezione saranno obbligatorio fare delle battaglie navali.
Il gioco Ã¨ un dlc stand alone, e uno che non ha mai giocato ad Assassin's Creed IV come fÃ  a capire come attaccare, abbordare, e muoversi in nave?
[h1]CONCLUSIONE[/h1]
Il dlc non Ã¨ malvagio, ma non lo si puÃ² considerare neanche tanto bello.
Ã¨ un riempitivo abbastanza inutile, la trama non Ã¨ niente di particolare , e le novitÃ  introdotte non mi sono piaciute piÃ¹ di tanto.
Se proprio siete curiosi di vedere una trama di schiavismo sul mondo di Assassin's Creed potrei consigliarvelo, ma sinceramente Ã¨ un dlc che potete pure evitare.
Per me il DLC Ã¨ abbastanza neutro",1491314268,1491314746,False,18,0,0.674742162227630615,2,False,False,False,False,,,

29282775,"{'steamid': '76561198164747584', 'num_games_owned': 27, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1134, 'last_played': 1484604642}",brazilian,MUITO BOM,1484512631,1484512631,True,1,0,0.458719462156295776,1,True,False,False,False,,,

29281483,"{'steamid': '76561198125118164', 'num_games_owned': 202, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 923, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 676, 'last_played': 1591005228}",english,"Assassin's Creed Freedom Cry is short but worth it nonetheless. Take note that it is originally a DLC for AC4 Black Flag.
The game revolves around Adewale, former first mate of the Assassin Edward Kenway. The game is set many years later from the events in Black Flag.
Adewale's story is about the rise of people enslaved for many generations. It basically embodies the very foundation of what the Assassins stand for: Freedom and love for life.
The graphics and mechanics is identical to Black Flag but there are new weapons and tools that are unique to the game.
In conclusion, I give the game 4/5 in my scale. If you love AC then go and play this gem, it will be one good ride.",1484508733,1484508733,True,1,0,0.522471904754638672,0,True,False,False,False,,,

Gameplay:

Das Gameplay an sich ist 1:1 wie bei AC4, auÃŸer das es ein paar neue Gadgets gibt die man nie wirklich braucht, auÃŸer wenn das Spiel einen dazu zwingt. Ansonsten ist das Gameplay aber auch solide, jeder dem AC4 gefallen hat kommt hier sofort zurecht und hat auch teilweise seinen SpaÃŸ.
Story:
Es gibt eine Story, die ich aber trotz mehrmaligem spielen der Missionen nicht richtig mitgekriegt/ verstanden habe. Im Endeffekt geht es darum Sklaven zu befreien die dann fÃ¼r einen arbeiten.
Content:

Es gibt zwar eine nette Openworld mit mehreren neuen Inseln und einem etwas grÃ¶ÃŸerem Dorf, jedoch wird diese einfach nicht genutzt. Im Storyverlauf ist man immer in dem selben Dorf/ Insel und selbst wenn man das Spiel auf 100% spielt muss man nicht auf die anderen Inseln/ Plantagen.

Was ich auch nicht verstehe ist das die so hÃ¤ufig kritisierten Belauschungsmissionen aus AC3 hier wieder reingebracht wurden obwohl diese wirklich keiner mochte. WÃ¤hrend es in AC4 von den besagten Missionen wirklich wenige bis gar keine gab, ist hier jede 3. Mission eine Belauschungsmission.

28259306,"{'steamid': '76561198118178688', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1481572916}",french,gros lag avec une gtx 970 impossible d'i jouÃ© la honte............,1481228694,1481228694,False,1,3,0.396415501832962036,11,True,False,False,False,,,

28195973,"{'steamid': '76561198127106857', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 280, 'last_played': 1494194673}",english,"I was impressed, with short gameplay time, I was expecting to feel disatisfied at the end. However there were many gameplay and story aspects that made an incredible impact upon me. However it wasn't perfect, the gameplay seemed to have taken some steps backwards on some improvements made in Black Flag. I'll make a simple pros and cons list, as I'm lazy and don't feel like writing a fully fleshed out essay.
Pros.

When passing by a slave interaction, I felt as if I had to help. I felt truly upset seeing the distreatment of slaves. This may have been great game design on Ubisofts part, or simply my morals. None the less, the distreatment of slaves made me truly angry, and I would only attempt to sneak if it risks the lives of the slaves. If my actions do not have consequence, I would go on a rampage, killing anyone in my way until I liberate the slaves.

Adewale has a certain brutality that you simply don't see in any of the other Assassins, you can only assume that it is due to his past. Him freeing himself, through incredibly brutal methods, smashing his ""masters"" skull in with a rock, as seen in the cinematic trailer. Along with his emotional attatchment to his cause, all grant a certain validation to his brutal methods.

The story is incredibly rich, especially for a DLC. The beginning of the climax nearly brought me to tears, as I could see the anger and sadness in Adewale's eyes, [spoiler] as he failed to save every slave. [/spoiler]
Cons.

While rescuing slaves, I asked myself ""Is my rescuing these slaves really helping everyone else? Or is it just pushing me closer to more character upgrades?"" There were no signs of a rebellion at all. In fact, there never was a true rebellion. The closest to a rebellion was [spoiler] Adewale running in solo to kill De Fayet, [/spoiler] which he needed absolutely no help with.

[spoiler] Adewale goes against the Assassin's beliefs of suffering when he kills De Fayet. It is believed in the Assassin's creed, while never explictly stated in the tenants of the creed, death should be quick and without suffering. As Mario Auditore said: ""Enough, Ezio! Show some respect"" and ""You are not Vieri, do not become him"" in Assassin's Creed 2. While this can be understood, given Adewale's emotional connection to this conflict, it left a disgusted taste in my mouth towards Adewale. As it made Adewale seem incredibly sadistic, and made me lose all respect for Adewale. I was hoping to see some form of punishment towards him from the Creed over this, however we know from Assassin's Creed: Rogue that this is not the case as he is seen as an incredibly respected symbol of the Creed. [/spoiler]

The Blunderbus recieved from the Marrons was rarely used. Its short range and single shot makes it practically useless. Better to use the sleep dart and assassinate them from the ground.",1480900389,1480900434,True,9,0,0.627623558044433594,0,False,False,False,False,,,

28089665,{'steamid': '76561198048178250', 'num_games_owned': 1156, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 319, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1486837579}",english,"I only reccomend this game if it's on sale. I remember playing this back on the PS3 and I was dissappointed I paid the $15 dollars for it. I was playing it at a time when I was burned out from Assassin's Creed. I practically skipped Unity and Syndicate and now here I am coming back to this game.
-The combat is still fun, but still easy as hell.
-Adewale is an alright character, but the story could be more fleshed out to make it worth $15
-Naval Combat still kickass
-Mouse and Keyboard feel awkward in my opinion. It's possible to play with it, but I'd rather use a controller.
-Same repetitive open world tropes, although it's not too bad.
-It's still Assassin's Creed

My beginning statement still stands. Get this on sale. Not worth $15. I personally feel more invested into a game I got for a damn good bargain.",1480476238,1480476238,True,5,0,0.554740667343139648,0,True,False,False,False,,,

24588658,"{'steamid': '76561198039394097', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 146, 'playtime_forever': 1348, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1085, 'last_played': 1554448289}",english,"Of all of the AC games I have played, I do truly applaud this one for breaking the norm for the assassin's gameplay. Shotgun, bigass machete, those are my kinda choices, much moreso than the 10,000th cute little sword I have had forced upon me.

The gameplay is the same as it ever was, but the changes to combat are fun. Maybe not game changing, but fun. Instead of being able to snipe a few baddies with pistols, you can blow the entire squad away with a single blunderbuss blast, and that is satisfying as all heck. However beyond that, the game is just another assassins creed, with the additional ship fun from black flag of course, but otherwise the same.

The story is... unfortunate. Another story with great potential whitewashed by the Extremo-PC team behind these games. The ""Maroons"" that this game depicts purely as these incredibly brave slaves who just wanna be free and live in peace, are nothing like the real life ones, known for literally catching and selling back escapes slaves (1740, Jamaican Maroon Treaty) Or the fact they often used black slaves themselves, in addition to the fact that escaped black slaves could be put to death for not joining the maroons. Forcing the enemy faction to be wholly evil and the allied one to be obviously good, discarding reality for fantasy, makes a game that should be serious and exciting into an idealistic children's novel.

Every ten yards there is a random event with white guy chasing down an escaping slave, going to blast him if ya dont intervene. Yanno, cuz everyone was blasting their expensive slaves on a regular basis. Not like they had slave hunters to bring them back or something like that.

The constant refusal to portray real events and peoples as they happened and as they were is why these stories always seem to be fairytale-esque. Because the enemy is bad and you are wholly good, no character development happens, we learn almost nothing new about Adewale, and the story can be summed up as ""Adewale ended up on an island, then escaped"" without leaving out anything important. The story tries REALLY hard to be meaningful but falls flat. A good breakoff story will have you going ""ah, thats why he did so and so in the other game"" this adds nothing to the main tale and reveals NOTHING about Adewale. A shame too, he is easily one of the characters in the series with the most unused potential.

For the terrible story, I do not think anyone would complain about having more black flag to play. The games combat modifications and the cool side quests about raiding plantations make it fun and a little fresh, with islands to explore and ship battles to enjoy, if you can look past the boring story, it is quite nice.

Also, for god's sake, stop claiming terrible stories are meaningful or special or deep because they MENTION slavery. There is a ton of emotional power, heroic moments, and deep tales to be found in this time period, no doubt, but this game doesn't come close to that, it has about as much deepness as an episode of ""Impotent Rage""

P.S: I love how, because the crew of his ships are always all black, when Adewale captures enemy crews, you see them embracing and they get brought on, only to vanish and be replaced with black sailors. That is some badass voodoo right there.",1469763048,1554430425,True,0,0,0,0,True,False,False,False,,,

24489011,"{'steamid': '76561197970519156', 'num_games_owned': 870, 'num_reviews': 186, 'playtime_forever': 406, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 406, 'last_played': 1469316275}",english,"One of the shortest AC games, but also one of the most powerful. Here, the AC series slips off the veil and goes full-on statement mode. Ade fights against the oppresion of slavery in Port au Prince, Facing the issue head on, if a bit violently. The story is about as long as one chapter of a typical AC game, but you'll murder about four times as many people in that time. Lots and lots of slave-holder's employees need to die here.

Usually I play AC games with a kind of cool detachment, kiling only when needed, and otherwise sticking to the mission and getting shit done. A few times in Freedom Cry, I found myself going out of my way to take out some of these jerks who were particularly nasty to the slaves, and I found myself feeling Ade's anger along with it.

If you were a little miffed that Black Flag basically ignored all the slavery going on around Edward, this one will take a step or two to remedy that.",1469316689,1469316689,True,2,0,0.530726253986358643,0,True,False,False,False,,,

23718109,{'steamid': '76561198050851038', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 984, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 984, 'last_played': 1464398612}",english,"[h1]Assassin's Creed: Freedom Cry[/h1]

Freedom Cry is a very good reason to return to the Black Flag world (if you needed one) to learn more about the Jackdaw's ex-quartermaster, AdÃ©walÃ©, 15 years laterâ€”with a more serious contextual approach and interesting new gameplay elements.
[b]Pros:[/b]
[list]
[*]AdÃ©walÃ© is a very convincing protagonist and a badass Assassin;
[*]Great story with an increased focus on the theme of slavery;
[*]Knowing that lives are at stake adds a sense of tension to plantation missions;
[*]Interesting reward-based system for acquiring additional gear;
[*]Locking main quests pending side quest progression is a good way to contextualise the latter;
[*]Lifeboats on each remote island make exploration easier;
[*]Good soundtrack.
[/list]
[b]Neutral:[/b]
[list]
[*]No present day storyline.
[/list]
[b]Cons:[/b]
[list]
[*]Over too soon;
[*]Random liberation events' red zones can get in the way of main missions.

23622195,"{'steamid': '76561198151995425', 'num_games_owned': 69, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1006, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 605, 'last_played': 1494368692}",english,"Underrated but incredible.

23554891,"{'steamid': '76561198030844709', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1034, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1034, 'last_played': 1465965636}",english,"[u]Overall:[/u]
Freedom Cry is a great DLC and I recommend it to those who both enjoy Black Flag and appreciate Adewale. If all you care about is Edward, then maybe stay away from this.
[u]What I liked:[/u]

+ Adewale is a fantastic character to play as. He also seems to be perhaps the most sensible Assassin that you get to play as, having a better understanding of the Creed and how decisions should reflect it...although maybe it's just more noticeable because he's contrasted with Edward, who doesn't really get it for a very long time.

+ I actually enjoyed being ""limited"" to the blunderbuss and machete as main weapons. The machete fits perfectly with Ade anyway, but the blunderbuss was a nice touch, even though I preferred the version that was better at range than spread.

+ I am very glad that you are able to simply sail around to take down ships and raid plantations as in the main game, so even if the story doesn't appeal to you, you can still have an enjoyable time wreaking havoc, freeing slaves, and upgrading the Experto Crede.
[u]What I disliked:[/u]
- The relative shortness of this DLC (which is understandable, so I don't count it as a negative).

- Aside from finishing the storyline fairly quickly, the liberation goals seemed to be set very low. I finished those before the story was over, so now that I've finished the story, there's not much to keep me playing, aside from trying to get 100% synchronization (which isn't too difficult when you don't have to complete all of the constraints in one playthrough).

- The fact that several of Ade's objectives, albeit optional, were geared toward being stealthy and/or non-violent, which I don't really feel suits his character. Especially in the setting, as a rather heavily-geared black man should stand out a lot more than someone like Edward would. While that can be used as justification for having Ade have more of a stealth emphasis, I would have liked for the game to have him just embrace that issue and put himself out there, daring people to challenge him.
- No sea shanties. At all. Disappointing.",1465923246,1465923331,True,18,3,0.72932887077331543,0,True,False,False,False,,,

22435639,"{'steamid': '76561198201270585', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 209, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 46, 'last_played': 1467657858}",english,yes,1460750166,1460750166,True,0,2,0.410863280296325684,0,False,False,False,False,,,

22434303,"{'steamid': '76561197981294625', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 667, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 667, 'last_played': 1460746009}",english,"I played Freedom Cry about 2 years after finishing the main game, Assassin's Creed IV: Black Flag.
It is an excellent DLC for what I think is one the best installment of all Assassin's Creed Series.
Just the fact that you get to sail again is great (although, sadly, there are no sea shanties).
But there is also a lenghty campaign story and lots of sidequests to keep you interested for about 10-12h, or less if you do not care for 100% completion.
I recommend this game if you have already played Black Flag.
If not, please play the main game first as it is definitely worth it, even if you do not like Assassin's Creed.
Yes, it is that good.",1460746243,1472814175,True,0,0,0,0,True,False,False,False,,,

22317461,"{'steamid': '76561198115761558', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 649, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 287, 'last_played': 1460200749}",english,"It is a good addition to the Assassin's creed line, but the story line could have been stronger. I get the fact that Adewale is helping the maroons and everything, but what else?! I was hoping for more insight to his life, because when I played Black Flag, I felt his story had to be heard. Slightly repetitive gameplay in terms of slave rescue missions. It took me approximately 10 hours to complete the game with 100% sync. Plus, I think we could manage knowing the other characters a bit more. But good effort by Ubisoft.",1460203546,1460203907,True,0,0,0,0,True,False,False,False,,,

21666125,"{'steamid': '76561198028818880', 'num_games_owned': 354, 'num_reviews': 364, 'playtime_forever': 1043, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 982, 'last_played': 1436793478}",czech,"Ak sa nechcete pustat do zbytocne rozsiahleho Black Flag, ale zaroven si chcete vyskusat rovnaky koncept. tak je pre vas Freedom Cry idealna alternativa. 21604038,"{'steamid': '76561198070462525', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 688, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 688, 'last_played': 1452373674}",english,"Well overall Freedom Cry is a really good game. 21556382,"{'steamid': '76561198139100697', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 525, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 428, 'last_played': 1466538629}",english,"Not really worth the money! 20941035,"{'steamid': '76561198002390546', 'num_games_owned': 1083, 'num_reviews': 131, 'playtime_forever': 848, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 848, 'last_played': 1413090969}",english,"You play as one of the more notable crewmembers of Edward Kenway's ship, the Jackdaw, famous from the game Assassin's Creed IV: Black Flag. Adewale is a black former slave from the old English-French-American triangle-trades where the blacks were used as slave to pick cotton, and different plants for plantage owners. Your main goal in this game is to free other (black) slaves.

Like 70% of the gameplay is to free slaves, and a bit is the old piracy from AC:IV where you steer another pirate ship just like in AC:IV but with Adewale as the captain onboard. It's some real fun if you didn't have enough of AC:IV. And myself, I miss AC:IV after finishing it because I feel that something more besides the campaign mode would be much appreciated. Like all non-standalone AC's, there's a bad multiplayer mode and I feel that this game fill up my needs for the piracy-part sequel I've always wanted.. And yes I know there's lots of piracy-ship games for onlineplay, but nothing with the graphics of the amazing AnvilNext gameengine. I do recommend this game if you're a fan of Assassin's Creed but likes the piracy-ship part of AC:IV more than the newer games like I for example.",1454541762,1454541762,True,0,0,0,0,True,False,False,False,,,

20718590,"{'steamid': '76561198061702251', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 123, 'playtime_forever': 134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1440383988}",english,"Freedom Cry tells the story of Edward's crewmaster (is that the word?), Adewale. 20627986,"{'steamid': '76561198118718008', 'num_games_owned': 1558, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 411, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 411, 'last_played': 1451514777}",english,"After playing Assassinâ€™s Creed IV Black Flag, I was excited to play Freedom Cry and to have a story dedicated to Adewale. Unfortunately, I found the story uninteresting and sometimes confusing. For example, Bastienne, the owner of the local brothel, will like Adewale at the beginning of one scene, then seem to hate him at the end for something he said, and then seem like she's in love with him the next time they meet without explanation or justification.

Then, there are the missions. Most of the missions are about as good as a middle of the road mission from Black Flag. The worst missions, however, are either boring or frustratingly difficult because of annoying placement of enemies or weird technicalities (Why do I have to swap a ship manifest WHILE two enemies are looking at it? Why can't I swap it while it's sitting unguarded? You know, as logic would dictate?)
If you enjoyed Black Flag, and you're wondering if you should play this game, just pass. You won't be missing anything.",1453228316,1453228316,False,0,0,0,0,True,False,False,False,,,

20410275,"{'steamid': '76561198027474775', 'num_games_owned': 769, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 360, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 360, 'last_played': 1452297675}",english,"Assassinâ€™s Creed Freedom Cry is a standalone game that follows the same pattern as its predecessor did, Black Flag, but this time the main protagonist was a secondary character on the previous title, AdÃ©walÃ©, being an assassin and many years after the ending of Black Flag, we found ourselves stranded on Port-au-Prince, with no ship and no crew, we must struggle to find our way out of there, though now his motivations are focused on the liberation of slaves that suffer greatly in the new world.
[h1]Story[/h1]

1735 is the year and AdÃ©walÃ© is now an Assassin, embracing the creedâ€™s beliefs and struggle, he finds himself stranded in Port-au-Prince. But after many years of piracy he decides now is time to put the Creedâ€™s name to a good use and begin a new fight and the liberation of slaves, helping the resistance called The Maroons for independence and dignity, AdÃ©walÃ© and his skills turn out to be of great help to the resistance. Before leaving, he helps building a new hope for the slaves.
[h1]Gameplay[/h1]

The game mechanics donâ€™t change that much compared to Black Flag, though some new load-out for a new assassin is required as per usual, for AdÃ©walÃ© we have now some powerful weapons like the blunderbuss and machete, while the blunderbuss is a one-shot gun, its power doesnâ€™t have match, it is a slow weapon but once you have multiple enemies facing you, one blow will kill most of them, if not all, making it a death fest every time you pull the trigger.

On the other hand, the machete is kind of new to us, we have mostly used swords before, but AdÃ©walÃ© with machete in hand makes him, perhaps the most brutal and relentless fighter of all assassins in my opinion, he is just a beast and the killing animations are proof of it, a good tool for a great and skilled killer.

Many other things remain the same, there are not many differences, smoke bombs, the rope dart and the poison and sleep darts are kept, a small addition were the firecrackers that will help you with guards at some point in the story, besides that, the game remains almost the same.
Naval combat is the same as well, and the map is very limited, but makes sense, this game is not that long and the exploration is restricted to some few islands and locations.

The interesting part of this game is and will always be slavery, our struggle is focused on the liberation of slaves, there are plantations in different parts of the map which can be raided and liberated, this will help you unlock new items and missions and also bring new people to the resistance, also during naval combat you will encounter enemy ships carrying many ore slaves, this ships cannot be attacked but they will always have protection. In the main city, small groups of slaves can be liberated as well, either from punishment, caging or auctions.
[h1]Graphics[/h1]
There are not many things to say on this point, it looks the same as Black Flag, equally beautiful, so if you want to know more, read my Black Flag review.
[h1]Sound and music[/h1]

The sound remains identical to Black Flag as well, voices are full of passion and the accents are great. On the music side, we have some new sounds and tunes that are related to the culture, some sort of African like melodies with chants in French, this makes the atmosphere of the game and the slavery theme. Awesome.
[h1]The bad[/h1]

While ACFC remains bug free and found no issues in-game, I really believe that some few things could have been different to my taste. For example, after liberating plantations, a good idea would have been to destroy at some point certain plantations, setting them on fire or destroying the crops, making them a waste of time to rebuild, this came to my mind after seeing how many times x plantation had a new owner after a few minutes, making it an endless loop of liberation, makes sense, yes, slaves were a profitable business back then and at some point someone will bring more and more, but stopping them once and for all would have been more satisfying in the end.
[h1]Final words[/h1]

ACFC is a good game on its own, it doesnâ€™t have the same spectrum as previous titles and the character is not developed in depth, but that is not a problem when it comes to action and the brutal way we kill enemies. There are some scenes that truly show how slavery was back in that time, it was terrible and at some point you can see how the life of the slaves was regarded as disposable by the masters and the empires. There are heartbreaking moments to say the least.

All in all, it was an enjoyable game, with more pros than cons, new tools and weapons and a very satisfying gameplay, AdÃ©walÃ© is a killing machine!",1452303127,1462692875,True,0,0,0,0,True,False,False,False,,,

20184565,"{'steamid': '76561198087016192', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1614, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1056, 'last_played': 1583819755}",english,"After playing through BF and FC there are very few changes. Yes its DLC, but it's a standalone game. Now plaing through this it reminded me of playing through Knife of Dunwall. Playing through a character that didn't get very much backstory and wondering what they did before or after when you met them is always a mystery. Until there's DLC. Anyway Ubisoft did pretty much the same thing the Bethesda did with Knife of Dunwall. They changed a few things, shortened it and made it really good. Now this is over priced and i think $7 would have been a better amount for it, but it is openworld and somethings are renewed and others are the same. The new things include being an assassin, liberating slaves, new main weapons, i,e blunderbuss and machete, new ways to get main weapons and pouches, plantations and slave ships, good story. The things that are renewed are upgrading the ship, though it is shortened, same stealth concept and diving places,and harpooning, again DLC. Anyway a new thing i like is finding new weapons and pouches. It was very nice that they incouraged exploration around the tiny map, and i wish there were more things to find. I also wish you could change your outfit, but i think they thought it wasn't worth the effort. One thing they could have done differently is animating the end ship  decision, it's the same thing but different. All in all it's a really good short game. 7/10",1451666482,1451666482,True,0,0,0.476190477609634399,0,True,False,False,False,,,

19978114,"{'steamid': '76561198024922437', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 467, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 467, 'last_played': 1451133679}",english,"I only can recommend this short add-on to AC4 if you really want to do just a couple more things in the pirate world.
Good news is you start the game off, or get very quickly, almost everything that took you the entire AC4 to get.  So you get to have fun with the tools and weapons you got accustmed to in AC4.
Any chance to use more Berseker Darts is ok in my book!!!!
The downside is there is almost no story to keep you motivated.  I actually finished the game and still had some of the tiny map undiscovered, but didn't care enough to play anymore.

In summary, if you want to play a little more AC4 gameplay, and can get this for cheap, then give it a shot. Just keep your expectations low and you will not be dissapointed.",1451172243,1451172243,True,0,0,0,0,True,False,False,False,,,

19605208,"{'steamid': '76561198041938685', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1460945022}",spanish,"No estÃ¡ mal,el tutorial bajo el agua es puto cÃ¡ncer pero es un buen juego

19553208,"{'steamid': '76561197990835108', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 300, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 300, 'last_played': 1449517763}",english,"Long story short, it's a shame this DLC wasn't expanded into a full-on game. The protagonist is an excellent character with plenty of historical motivation and a stellar voice performance to match. If you enjoyed AC Black Flag then definitely check this one out!
Cons:

-boring on-foot boilerplate missions (spy on this, tail that, stay within range of this while avoiding a swarm of annoying that, blah blah blah...you know the drill by now if you've played every other game in the franchise)
Pros:
-excellent story and characters
-one emotional objective in a mission involves saving slaves from a sinking ship that ought to remind you just what an amazing species we truly are. That story point alone is worth the entire DLC
-gorgeous music; probably better than the base game
-a rare topic like that for a game. Ubi ought to run with it and give Adewale his full game!",1449518310,1449518310,True,15,3,0.639677703380584717,1,True,False,False,False,,,

19436915,"{'steamid': '76561198260066707', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 434, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 378, 'last_played': 1490875628}",english,Im a big fan of assasins creed this is a very short game more of a expantion pack than anything else but if like me you just finished black flag and just want some more sailing in a ship its great you dont play the same person as in black flag this one you play an x slave going around freeing more slaves i finished this game really quickly i wouldnt pay a lot for it but i enjoyed it all the same,1449063847,1449063962,True,0,0,0,0,True,False,False,False,,,

19413820,"{'steamid': '76561198180476627', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 1526, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1526, 'last_played': 1447603209}",english,"This review is for those who actually have played Assassins Creed Black Flag. If you do not have it I suggest you buy it at a sale because the main game will be cheaper than the dlc since the price is only slightly higher but the overall content is more aswell.

I own Assassins Creed on XBox 360 and the game simply is breathtaking with the easy to learn gameplay, the open world features and the good and atmospheric music. The story however was a little short and Freedom Cry as a dlc is of course even shorter. Most players suggest an average gametime of only 4-6 hours. However it took me about 20 Hours to discover all the places unlock everything and tried the minigames like fishing. (They are the same as in Black Flag though)

Adewale has his own combat style and uses a machete. Like Kennway he can use firearms, ropedarts, poisoned darts etc. The overall gameplay is the same as in Black Flag but the story is set 20 years later. (I wont say much about it since i dont want to spoiler and it depends on your taste if you will enjoy it or not).
The map is not very big, i am guessing less than 25% of Black Flags overall map but the locations have their own appearance and are detailed.
I did not encounter any notable bugs but I was a bit dissappointed that Adewales ship is a repainted Jackdaw.
The ship however cannot be upgraded as much as the Jackdaw.

A new element in the game is as already mentioned Adewales own combat style and the ability to free slaves either by boarding slave ships or by killing the overseers at the plantations. Some of the overseers have become very hostile and will attack you instantly. If you are spotted on the plantations, the overseers are going to kill your maroonfellows so you should really take care.
The plantations sooner or later always get new owners so you can replay this part. The game also can be continued after the story has come to an end just like in Black Flag.

If you enjoyed Black Flag and want some more story related content or discover some more West Indies locations I really recommend this but dont expect a lot of new content. Also keep an eye out for a decent sale, I suggest maybe 3-5 dollars is a good price.",1448981987,1448988659,True,6,0,0.571034491062164307,0,True,False,False,False,,,

It assumes that you are fresly out of AC 4 and kicking ass. It has been a year since I last played the prequel and it was really hard to get back in. There is no progression (or almost) your character and boats are super buffed from the start. The narrative is almost absent. The story is not interesting. There are too much ""rescue"" mission in the same place, I keep getting 2 missions at a time... 18953740,"{'steamid': '76561197971017985', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 134, 'playtime_forever': 154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1446993386}",french,"AC4 est un bon Assassin's Creed. Un des meilleurs Ã  mon sens. Cet add-on n'est pas mauvais, mais il est dÃ©cevant.

En effet, le sujet abordÃ© mÃ©rite d'Ãªtre bien dÃ©veloppÃ©, AC4 et est un trÃ¨s bon cadre pour le faire. Adelawe, le second de Kenway dans AC4, est un personnage Ã  gros potentiel qu'il Ã©tait logique d'utiliser pour cet add on et pour cette thÃ©matique. Facile donc ?
Oui ...

Et pourtant, Ubi a survolÃ© la sujet, l'add-on se plie en 2h maxi en prenant son temps, durant lequel on ""grinde"" plus la libÃ©ration d'esclave pour dÃ©bloquer du matos d'assassin (logique ?) et des amÃ©liorations de bateau (lÃ  aussi, logique ?). Le commerce ne sert Ã  rien, les esclaves et les marrons sont juste un ""compteur"" indiquant les palliers de progressions... c'est trÃ¨s lÃ©ger.

Et Adelawe, pourtant pourvu d'une certaine sagesse dans AC4, se conduit comme un bourrin Ã©cervelÃ© dans ce ""scenario"", causant presque autant de torts que le ""gros mÃ©chant"" qu'on apperÃ§oit Ã  peine.

C'est donc, de mon point de vue, une grande dÃ©ception de voir avec quelle lÃ©gÃ¨retÃ© a Ã©tÃ© traitÃ© l'un des Ã©pisodes les plus honteux de notre histoire.",1446994327,1446994327,False,30,3,0.714876472949981689,0,True,False,False,False,,,

18764175,"{'steamid': '76561198161141911', 'num_games_owned': 536, 'num_reviews': 487, 'playtime_forever': 182, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1446211944}",english,"I wasn't a big fan of black flag i gave it a 7/10 and this standalone dlc is more of the same. I wish they had done more with the story and the character of Adewale because the concept is great. You are liberating slaves and this was the games chance to tell a really good and emotional story but they failed to do that.The main story is only 3 hours long but there are extra islands to explore and collectables which should add a few more hours. I didn't bother doing any of that because i just wanted the story to be over and done with so i could go play something else which is not a good thing. Unless you are a massive fan of black flag i see no reason to play this, even if you are a massive fan this dlc doesn't do much to flesh out the story of the main game because there is barely any story at all.
5/10 (Average)",1446210872,1524203712,False,0,0,0,0,True,False,False,False,,,

18671151,"{'steamid': '76561197977670448', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1016, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1016, 'last_played': 1413900540}",french,:),1445750688,1445750688,True,0,0,0,0,True,False,False,False,,,

18654733,"{'steamid': '76561198056723676', 'num_games_owned': 645, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 949, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 904, 'last_played': 1445675853}",english,"Freedom Cry has its problems (which I'll get into here in a bit) and it doesn't really do much for the overarching narrative of the series as a whole, but it's still fun to play.

You play as Adewale, member of the Assassins and Edward Kenway's former quartermaster. You begin on the seas in your ship on a mission to intercept a Templar package.  After a brief naval battle, you sail through a storm and end up in Port au Prince in Sam Domingue. From there onwards, you do all kinds of Assassin-y stuff on your own personal mission (of sorts) to free slaves and uncover a plot by Pierre, marquis de Fayet to...do stuff.

Freedom Cry doesn't really offer anything new that Black Flag didn't. In fact, a bit less, which makes sense when you consider the fact that it was originally just a DLC pack before it became a standalone game. Oh and they weren't kidding when they said standalone. If you've never played a single Assassin's Creed title before this one, you won't have any problems grasping what's going on, as it really doesn't have anything to do with the main plot of the series. But, I digress.

You get two main weapons: a machete and a blunderbuss (as well as your hidden blades, but hidden blades in Assassin's Creed are a given at this point). Both can be upgraded with different versions, but still, the lack of variety in weapon types is a little disappointing. But, again, it's DLC. Most of the side weapons from Black Flag are present, including the blow gun and the rope dart.

The naval combat is as excellent as ever, though if you haven't played Black Flag it may take a little while to grasp as there's no real tutorial for it here. Your ship, the Experto Crede, is slightly upgradeable with a few gun and mortar upgrades, as well as a hull upgrade. You can also (kind of) customize its appearance with some nifty anti-slavery decorations.

Very basically, it's a slightly stripped-down Black Flag with a different main character and a much shorter storyline. Very fun to play, frustrating as hell at times, and (SLIGHT SPOILER ALERT THINLY VEILED IN RIDDLE) it'll leave you feeling a bit like Brad Pitt's character at the end of Seven. Remember Seven? Man, that was a good movie. What? Oh, right. The review. Um, yeah. Play this game. And stuff.",1445682224,1445682224,True,0,0,0.42166447639465332,0,True,False,False,False,,,

18214462,"{'steamid': '76561198049105851', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 191, 'playtime_forever': 275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 236, 'last_played': 1470773701}",english,"Well, here we finally are. About f***ing time.
It took me forever to get this game to work on my old laptop, but now I've finally loaded this thing up!
.... On a separate laptop. With a much better graphics card. And processor.

I could rant like I did before about Ubisoft being far too prissy about their graphics, but I'm sure anyone who did play this game actually read the system requirements. But I suppose I could get mad that Ubisoft also requires you install UPlay, their far inferior attempt to compete against Steam and Origin.

Well, the store itself is pretty sh***y, but the Ubi30 free game deal is pretty sweet. And once you get UPlay actually up, the game starts and runs just fine... although it will remind you how fast the game is running in the top left corner as a default option. Just so the extreme PC Master Race freaks can reminds themselves what a great decision they made to depart from being console owners.

The game looks good. The game plays good. But that's really because it's just Assassin's Creed IV condensed. Sure, it says ""Standalone Game"" in the pictures of it, but this is really just an inflated DLC pack. But still a better one than today's standard of DLCs.

You play as Adewale as he fights against racism and slavery in the West Indies. You're given a small map to work with as Adewale or in his own pirate ship and crew. And that's all good and dandy, but how does the story fare?

It's alright. Yeah, it's about racial discrimination, which is never the most subtle topic but it's still handled well in this story. The overall point isn't shoved in your face like some other racial stories. What I can't stand in this game was the requirement to gather slaves or perform menial tasks before unlocking the next story mission, which seems pretty foolish to me. It takes the focus away from the story and into the player just crossing off items on a checklist.

I'm also not a fan of how in this game, like several later Assassin's Creed games can get with reserved acting. Even in the highest resolution and graphical settings, the characters in this story are just bland and not very expressive, so it makes cutscenes less engaging as a player.

If you love Black Flag to death and want a little more story and some more gameplay mechanics, then this is definitely for you. But I'm still sticking with not recommending it for anyone who wants to play just this and nothing else. Black Flag felt more like a well-made meal, and Freedom Cry feels more like a desert that's filled with just some poorly-cooked vegetables. I'm giving Assassin's Creed: Freedom Cry a 5/10",1443328879,1470774752,False,0,1,0,0,True,False,False,False,,,

18050522,"{'steamid': '76561198028005623', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 656, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 496, 'last_played': 1476693985}",english,"This is a great place to start for anyone who hasnt played an Assassins creed game before. its stand alone and wont take too long to get into. If you see this go on sale (as it should be every sale season) by all means buy it, even for a friend if your  trying to convince someone to give it a try. if youve been thinking about this series for some time now you wont be dissapointed.

To anyone who is new to this series and wants to keep playing more: After completeing and enjoying Assassins Creed: Freedom Cry, you could follow it up any one of the AC games that takes place within 100 years of this, with Black Flag being the most similar. Or go back to basics with the original assassins creed and AC:II through AC: Revelations

the only downside to this purchase that I can think of is that even if its stand alone, it is still DLC. being so, there arent too many tutorials to any mechanics that werent introduced in this add on. you may consider playing this while you have an Assassins Creed fan that you can talk to",1442361472,1442362191,True,9,2,0.574298501014709473,0,True,False,False,False,,,

FAZIT: Das Spiel ist sehr kurz â€“ ich war nach knapp 7 Stunden durch. Allerdings gibt es viele MÃ¶glichkeiten, den SpielspaÃŸ zu verlÃ¤ngern, indem man noch mehr Sklaven befreit oder mit dem (aufrÃ¼stbaren) Schiff die Karibik unsicher macht.

Wer wissen will, ob die Assassins Creed-Reihe etwas fÃ¼r ihn ist, der sollte genau hier zuschlagen â€“ schmaler Preis, sehr gutes Spiel und ein kurzer, aber wirkungsvoller Einblick in das Creed-Universum.

17860367,"{'steamid': '76561197974627682', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 124, 'playtime_forever': 971, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 971, 'last_played': 1440966315}",english,"AC: Freedom Cry

Short, standalone story with simple premise, but featuring two strong characters that have some quite good conversations in between the missions and are the best thing about this DLC. Other than that, it's very similar to AC4, taking most of the features, often simplifing them, since it's on much smaller scale, and unfortunately bearing all the problems AC games have.

And the bugs! Oh god, the glitches. I've never seen something like this (haven't played Unity yet) - enemies suddenly spawning from their dead comrades (and instantly raising alarm), friendly AI falling down from ladders and killing themselves, invisible enemies that appear on minimap, the good old ""I just wanted to jump over that wall, not walk on it"", just to name few that were the most memorable, but I kid you not, when this DLC breaks, it breaks hard. I do not remember having such a hard time with AC4 or any previous AC.

Still, even without the bugs, the experience is very limited and other than the story, the exploration is so bare bone that it honestly isn't worth it, you won't find anything different from AC4, where pretty much everything is more fleshed out, so I can only recommend this for the story and when on sale, not for it's regular asking price.
Decent, but (often) flawed experience.",1441278018,1441278031,True,13,4,0.631189227104187012,0,True,False,False,False,,,

17129955,"{'steamid': '76561198127187833', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 443, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 409, 'last_played': 1473946739}",english,"Excellent DLC, excellent gameplay! 5/5",1437337136,1437337136,True,0,0,0,0,False,False,False,False,,,

17101987,"{'steamid': '76561198230147936', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 405, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 402, 'last_played': 1442148801}",english,"After being a massive fan of Black Flag and the thrilling story line of Mr Edward Kenway, mixed in with the wonderful experience of sailing his own ship into battle, I have to say this 'expansion' was a great way to extend the thrills. Playing as Edwards mate Adewale in a smaller section of the Carribean, essentially starting a slave rebellion, the short yet intense gameplay brings a lot of similar action to Black Flack with a great story line to boot.

The game is fairly short with the story line and there is a few things that can help occupy your time that are similar to Black Flag, with diving spots and whale hunting. Ship battles never get old, although you can fairly quickly advance your ship, making all but battles with a few of the toughest ships a challenge.

As a fan of the series (not as big a fan of Unity) I would highly reccomend purchasing this cheap yet exciting 5 or so hour long game you will get your monies worth and if its on sale then its a steal.
Pros:
- Great story line
- Smooth combat system
- Return of the 'Adewale'
- Ship battles!!!
Cons:
- Mission stories are quick to finish
- Too easy to level up 'Experto Creed' (ship)
- Not enough equiptment to obtain
- No legendary ship to defeat

Overall this is a great edition to the Black Flag saga to bring back the memories of maybe the best game of the series. It maybe too easy to give any serious gamer a struggle, though for the price it would take up a chilled weekend. I got this game on sale so very happy with the price for the experience.",1437192759,1437193229,True,1,0,0.527559041976928711,0,True,False,False,False,,,

17031283,"{'steamid': '76561198057575998', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1065, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 635, 'last_played': 1436461564}",english,"This trumped â€“ down, Black Flag spin â€“ off can easily be described in four words: Pure, unadulterated, machete mayhem. Freedom Cry suffers from the same issues that all these little filler titles in the series face. It is small in scale, meaning that from the grandiose Black Flag Caribbean, you now get to basically explore a rather small Port-au-Prince, some plantations and beaches and a single wreck. It is less polished, with a fast and easy story whose completion comes rather swiftly and without much diversity. Lastly, the characters donâ€™t give off the same attraction as in the main titles of the series.

The above is not to say that Freedom Cry doesnâ€™t have its good aspects. The weapon and upgrade acquisition mechanics have been simplified, to the extent where they liberate the player from grinding money to acquire a new weapon or a ship upgrade, taking a menial task of a playerâ€™s shoulders and allowing for more slave â€“ freeing. Which, slave â€“ freeing, is done with ample use of your machete and blunderbuss, adding to this loose yet deadly feeling of the title. There is a liberating feeling on just hacking and scatter-shooting your way through the streets, while at the same time freeing the unfortunate slaves paraded about. Adewale is also pretty cool as a character, though he lacks an adequate support cast.

The controls are the same as in Black Flag, so if youâ€™ve been there, you can jump right in here. There is also some nice music and signing, appropriate for the culture of the people ferried in as slaves to the plantations, which gives a nice feeling of change to the previously known Europe-based musical scores. The game remains definitively easy though, with almost nothing to offer in terms of difficulty, challenge and replayability.

Freedom Cry is by no means a bad game. It is just too small and limited in scope for me to be able to recommend it as a purchase to someone, as not playing it doesnâ€™t really deprive you of anything.",1436811951,1436811951,False,0,0,0,0,True,False,False,False,,,

16912598,"{'steamid': '76561198086373231', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 828, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 828, 'last_played': 1436200294}",english,"This was originally a DLC for Assassin's Creed IV: Black Flag.You play as Adewale the quartermaster of Jackdaw. 16887341,"{'steamid': '76561198093982570', 'num_games_owned': 346, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 491, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 491, 'last_played': 1419322228}",english,"Requires Uplay.

Freedom Cry an expansion of AC IV: Black Flag is the perfect Assassin's Creed game long enough to be engaing and filled with content that has a fair bit of replayability without being tiresome or too overtly repetitive. Its story while not packed with narrative; has enough to keep you interested without getting lost in its own mythology, and well-written characters that don't just feel like plot points. Graphically identical to Black Flag, with a fairly large open space to roam around in. The only drawback to the game is the content outside the main story is not as high in quality and can fell more like padding than content at times.

If you want the Assassin's Creed experience in a more digestiable manner without being bloated with boring content and bugs this is the game for you.",1436063725,1436063803,True,0,0,0,0,True,False,False,False,,,

16562532,"{'steamid': '76561198094707710', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 1246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1037, 'last_played': 1440432661}",english,"You let out a cry of freedom as you return
home from work, dead tired.
Itâ€™s bad enough youâ€™ve been juggling school
and a part-time job at the bookstore, in
addition to your growing relationship with
the beautiful Goth in the class, _Summer-Rain_.
Sheâ€™s been arguing with you lately.
Logging in to Steam once more after dragging
your feet from the bath, you see a game
that you donâ€™t seem to remember:
Assassinâ€™s Creed: Freedom Cry.
You vaguely recall that it focused on the
supporting character, Adewale; from the
fourth title in the series, Black Flag, and it
was originally marketed as DLC before
becoming a standalone title.
Shrugging, you buy and soon install the game.
You try not to think about the things you
had to put up with throughout the week
in the back of your head; that idiot boss
you hate but you need your job more,
the school projects getting more mentally
demanding and _ Summer-Rain_ arguing
with you over a misunderstanding.
Whether youâ€™re a returning player from
Black Flag or someone entirely new with
no knowledge of the series, Freedom Cryâ€™s
story is the main draw of the game, being
simple, accessable and without any obvious
baggage from the previous games.
Freedom Cryâ€™s cast is limited to revolving
around only four characters; Adewale himself,
his person-of-interest; the beautiful Bastienne
Josephe, the local Madame of the Brothel in
Port-Au-Prince, the evil Governeur De Fayet
and the stoic Augustin Dieufort, leader of the
Maroon Rebellion.
Most of Assassinâ€™s Creed: Black Flag is on
display at its finest here. The activities like
whaling for animal skins and crafting materials
return in a smaller capacity, the naval combat
and free-running are top-notch as ever and
the graphics can bring an underequipped
PC to ruin.
You find yourself giggling as you see your idiot
boss in the villainous Governeur De Fayet, and
you relish how satisfying it is to go around
freeing your brothers in chains while you kill
Slavers and soldiers who oppress and bully.
Each mission or small side-quest you complete
brings you closer to the real-world, so you can
resume your responsibilities without the urge to
take a machete into your bossâ€™s face or kill your
classmates for not doing enough in your group
projects.
Freedom Cryâ€™s ending makes you pick up
the phone to apologize to _Summer-Rain_.
She asks what brought about this change of
heart. You tell her about Freedom Cry.
How you bought a game of prejudice, which
was also with a means to fight it and the effort
it came with to fight such things like prejudice,
racism and slavery.
How you bought newfound gratitude for your
life and things you have. The things you took
for granted, and the things you had taken for
granted.
The people you had taken for granted.
She responds, dabbing her eyes.
â€œLetâ€™s not fight... Not when we can play
games like the one you just finished.â€
You answer while smiling on the other end.
â€œYouâ€™re right, Summer. Let Freedom Cry.â€

16543713,"{'steamid': '76561197997114112', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 408, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 408, 'last_played': 1434775554}",english,"A short, pleasant addition to one of the best games, if not the best, in the Assassin's Creed franchise, Black Flag. This expansion is quite short (I logged 6.8h), but has great voice acting, great graphics, and mostly the same great gameplay from the base game. In addition to the standard assassin gear (smoke bombs, sleep and berzerk darts, dual hidden blades), Adewale has more powerful moves (a brutal machete and a room-clearing blunderbuss), but he often must refrain from using them in order to save the lives of captives and slaves. At sea, it's much the same: slave ships are escorted. They don't fight themselves, and if you damage them while fighting the escorts, it will cost lives you might otherwise have saved.

The explorable area is much smaller than Black Flag, which is understandable, but I felt like some of the smaller islands were copies of each other. Secrets and collectibles generally require little or not effort to find, though they aren't as often visible on the mini-map as they were in Black Flag. The side missions to free slaves and gain rebels are great at first, feeling both thematic and rewarding, but they become a bit tedious, as they repeat endlessly in dense but small Port au Prince. Clearing the plantations is rewarding and fun, but there aren't many plantation types, so you'll see copies. Some plot points feel like they could have been expanded too. There's good material and potential that perhaps should have been its own full game, like Rogue.

Recommended with reservation. Play Black Flag, and if you want more, here it is. It runs great and looks great and is just different enough, and fun enough, to be worth those few hours.",1434778714,1434778714,True,0,0,0,0,True,False,False,False,,,

16542051,"{'steamid': '76561198038778310', 'num_games_owned': 677, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 304, 'last_played': 1434527200}",english,"The game's essentially Black Flag with AdÃ© and a smaller open world. 16522590,"{'steamid': '76561198040635693', 'num_games_owned': 792, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 260, 'last_played': 1434713388}",english,"Assassins Creed Freedom Cry is effectively a 3 â€“ 6 hour long DLC (I finished it closer to 3 even with finding collectables though) and for what itâ€™s marketed as, itâ€™s very good.

The game puts you in the shoes of Adewale (who from what Iâ€™ve played of ACIV:BF is a main character) and a heavy chunk of the game is aimed at freeing slaves and helping the faction on the island accomplishing this. Most of the main story and missions are completed around this island, but for a 3-6 hour DLC, the actual explore able map is fairly large, and ship combat also plays a part when completing a few of the objectives. The ship combat is as it was in ACIV â€“ fun but extremely repetitive at times (though I prefer the sword combat to ships anyway).

Outside of missions and a few collectables though, thereâ€™s not an awful lot to do. In the 4 hours I played, I achieved 90% completion, with the other 10% being collectables I missed on one of the islands as I didnâ€™t have a â€œneedâ€ to explore it. There are side objectives on missions and such to flesh out the replay ability a bit, and some of these objectives take a bit of thinking and time to achieve â€“ but bar Uplay achievements thereâ€™s no need to accomplish them unless youâ€™re a completionist.

And yes, there is Uplay integration and you need Uplay running and installed to play the game â€“ doesnâ€™t bother me in the slightest as Iâ€™ve never had issues, but I know for some Uplay is an issue.
[b]Would I recommend it at the Â£11.99 retail price?[/b] Not at all, unless you really enjoyed Black Flag, though at that point
you probably would have bought this as the DLC with the game.
[b]Would I recommend it at the price of Â£3.74 I got it at on sale?[/b] Definitely.

If you enjoyed Assassins Creed and want to have a taste of what IV is like before committing then this is a great start. Though if other Assassins Creed games are on sale at the same time (as usually is the case on steam) Iâ€™d look at Assassins Creed 3 or Brotherhood which usually come to the same Â£3.74 price tag and provide a much more full experience.",1434715940,1434715970,True,0,0,0,0,True,False,False,False,,,

Basically, if you're looking for ""A bit more of Black Flag"", than this is the game for you, kinda. It's rather limited in scope, in terms of both gameplay and storyline. 15814772,"{'steamid': '76561198054118964', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 1006, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 393, 'last_played': 1453414192}",english,"Freedom Cry is a great example of DLC done right; it had the potential to be a full game of its own with the slavery setting.

The story was short but well made for a DLC, Adewale is a great character to play as you struggle to liberate the maroons from slavery with the help of a good set of interesting characters. I enjoyed Adewaleâ€™s â€œpath of freedomâ€ so much that I think this truly deserved more attention as a game and not only a short DLC, since they could have done a lot with this story.

The gameplay is the same as Black Flag with a few new weapons and tools, but itâ€™s still enjoyable. Adewale has his own ship, which you can use to free slave from other ships. Currency is instead replaced with the amount of slaves you free from plantations, prisons or punishments.

It really was a good change from the main game to play as Adewale, I really recommend anyone to buy this DLC but wait for sales, it contains a few short but enjoyable hours of story and good changes in gameplay.

15316170,"{'steamid': '76561198170332598', 'num_games_owned': 41, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 587, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 448, 'last_played': 1429931329}",brazilian,otimo game recomendo...historia fantastica e jogabilidade 1000,1428807733,1428807733,True,2,0,0.544235885143280029,0,True,False,False,False,,,

15309998,"{'steamid': '76561198043192670', 'num_games_owned': 543, 'num_reviews': 323, 'playtime_forever': 428, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 307, 'last_played': 1442441402}",english,"The first, and last, Ubisoft game I will ever get on PC.

I reccomend this to the fans of the series as a final look at the AC series to make you think, ""Hey, I've had this exact experience for 8 games, and it's only been getting more and more watered down.""

It is an alright game, with bad optimization, stale graphics, and a story cheesy enough to make a few pizzas. Didn't take me long to beat it, and was one of the worst video game endings I've ever seen as far as development, closure, and appeal.

For $3.75, it's about what you pay for. Anything more is a waste. I'm going to pretend Assassin's Creed Revelations was the last AC game, because these last few games have sucked pretty bad. AC:4 didn't even feel like an AC game. 15150833,"{'steamid': '76561198057584522', 'num_games_owned': 708, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 606, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 586, 'last_played': 1527485290}",english,"Make no mistake, even if Freedom Cry was originally a DLC expansion it's just as good as the main game, Ubisoft made the right decision making this a standalone release, and even though it's only about 12 hours long (unless you want to achieve 100% synch) every minute of it is top quality.

15144528,"{'steamid': '76561198029579296', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 125, 'playtime_forever': 286, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 286, 'last_played': 1427745304}",german,"Wenn das Spiel in einem Sale fÃ¼r unter 5 Euro zu haben ist, wÃ¼rde ich sagen, dass es eine nette ErgÃ¤nzung zu Black Flag ist., aber 15 Euro finde ich einfach zu viel.

FÃ¼r mich war Black Flag einer der schwÃ¤chsten Teile, ich fand die Story wirr zusammengewÃ¼rfelt und nichtssagend, das setzt sich meinem Empfinden nach in Freedom Cry fort. Teilweise wird einem gesagt, dass das ErfÃ¼llen der vorgegebenen Mission fÃ¼r die Gesamtsituation der Menschen in der Spielwelt keinen Nutzen hat, das Spiel lÃ¤sst einen am Ende aber da stehen, als wÃ¤re es doch die LÃ¶sung allen Ãœbels gewesen. Im Prinzip spielt man einen undurchdachten Rachefeldzug in einem Aquarium (die Spielwelt ist sehr klein). In 3 Stunden ist man locker mit der Hauptstory durch.
Eine positive Sache mÃ¶chte ich aber erwÃ¤hnen: Es gibt keine Spielabschnitte in der Gegenwart. HALLELUJAH!",1427827196,1427827196,False,4,0,0.509920179843902588,0,True,False,False,False,,,

15131983,"{'steamid': '76561198035759205', 'num_games_owned': 406, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1566, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1566, 'last_played': 1427750785}",english,"I am a fan of Assassin's Creed series and I played most of them.
Freedom Cry is the first AC game I have played on my PC (all previous were on X360) but still using the same X360 controller so I was very used to AC mechanics.
I have Black Flag and I have completed it like the previous ones with 100% synchronization so my approach is rather not a casual gamer one.
Maybe the good stuff first:
- Naval battles - they are quite enjoyable and still give a lot of fun.
... and for me that was it.
The stuff that was annoying:

- Glitches ... a lot of them ... some minor, some heavy, some crashes. For e.g. in one of the missions I was talking to some salesman and listening to his explanations and also observing a queue to fish stand next to mine. Well it was quite impressive cause 6 people who bought fish from this guy they just ... disappeared. Yeah just after trade was done, every one of them got deleted from Animus. As you watched them. Another example. During fights it is very likely that you will get badly synchronized enemies, whose bodies react to your punches or combos being few meteres to the side of your grab or machete slice. Final example is ships and enemies spawning from thin air just because you were too quick to get somewhere before the game was able to load it. For 14 hours I played Freedome Cry bugs presence was way to often (12 hours extra was logged by steam when I left my computer running with AC opened doing some other stuff).

- Respawn time of slave liberation events. It did'nt matter that I just rescued some convoy or stopped the punishmet on poor slave souls ... nope turn around went few steps the othere way and bam we have another convoy to rescue. Very annoying when you try to do story missions with all that auctions and running slaves crossing your path every 50-100 metres. Very badly thought out.

- Saturation of ships sailing thru quite small naval area that you are limited to. Do not be surprised that in every moment of your sea escapade there will be at least 2-5 ships in your view range. Quite crowdy to be honest even after 15 ships plunder series that I made after game completition.

I do not recommend to play this game as a first experience with AC series. You will be thrown deep into mechanics and possibilities of weapons and gadgets that there will be no tutorials for (like rope arrows or smoke bombs).
I do not recommend this part as a stand alone game. As a DLC it might be a little better (especially after completeing Black Flag) but on itself is quite bad.
I do not recommend this game on PC. Too many glitches, bugs and crashes.

I do recommend this game only to some hardcore AC fans who were not bored with Black Flag, but they want to free some slaves in the process of plundering every nations ships and harpooning some big fishes (or whales ... or killer whales).
I had some fun but it was not enough considering amount of time I have spent playing.
In summary as a stand alone game it is not worth its price.",1427754967,1427822709,False,0,0,0,0,True,False,False,False,,,

15036312,"{'steamid': '76561198068093805', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 990, 'last_played': 1427831986}",german,Ich findÂ´s cool!,1427217932,1427217932,True,3,0,0.476513564586639404,0,True,False,False,False,,,

15031442,"{'steamid': '76561198043969506', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 628, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 628, 'last_played': 1427188542}",german,"GrundsÃ¤tzlich ein Ã¼beraus solides Spiel, welches seinem Preis mehr als gerecht wird. Wie bereits viele Reviews schon passend erkannt hat, bietet dieses Spiel Assassins Creed-Neulingen eine Chance, die Serie fÃ¼r wenig Geld anzuspielen.

Hier folgt gleich mal ein kleiner Kritikpunkt, den man ruhig anders lÃ¶sen hÃ¤tte kÃ¶nnen. Mir fehlt ein kleines Tutorium, die einem die Steuerung nÃ¤her bringt. Als ich das Spiel startete fand ich mich sofort in einer Seeschlacht wieder, ohne Ahnung, wie man steuerte oder kÃ¤mpfte. Ich musste somit mehrmals das Spiel neustarten - Diese Tatsache kann sehr wohl dazu fÃ¼hren, dass Neulinge das Spiel frustriert in eine Ecke werfen wÃ¼rden.
Ebenso fehlt mir eine kleine Vorgeschichte - klar, es ist ein DLC, aber als Standalone-Spiel hÃ¤tte ich mich trotzdem Ã¼ber eine kleine Diashow gefreut, die einem eine kleine EInleitung lieferten.

Ein weiterer kleiner Kritikpunkt ist, dass im Spiel nicht wirklich hervorgeht, in welchem Zeitraum die Story spielt. Nach erstmaligem durchsielen hatte ich das GefÃ¼hl, die Story wÃ¤re in zwei-vier Wochen Story abgehandelt. Als ich dann die ""Animus-Datenbank"" durchgelesen hatte war ich Ã¼berrascht zu lesen, dass die ca. 10 Missionen-Story tatsÃ¤chlich mehrere Jahre umfassen soll. Dies kommt leider Ã¼berhaupt nicht zur Geltung.

Der Rest des Spiels lÃ¤uft in Ã¼blicher Assassins-Creed Manier ab mit Ã¼blicher Steuerung und Kampfmodi. Die Welt ist sehr schÃ¶n designed und die knapp erzÃ¤hlte Kampagne Ã¼ber die SklavenaufstÃ¤nde in der Karibik zÃ¤hlen fÃ¼r mich zu den Besten der Serie.

Was mir auch sehr gut gefallen hat (was andere vermutlich verneinen werden) ist, dass versteckte Kisten und mÃ¶glichen auf einer Insel zu entdeckenden Geheimnisse angezeigt werden, sobald man sich an der Spitze einer WindmÃ¼hle ""synchronisiert"" hat. Dies gefÃ¤llt mir persÃ¶nlich  viel besser als stupides herumlaufen mit dem Wissen, ohnehin niemals alle Kisten zu finden - seien wir uns ehrlich: wer sucht schon ALLE versteckten Truhen etc. ohne einen Online-Ratgeber zu Rate zu ziehen? - eben!

Das Spiel ist auf jedem Fall Top und wÃ¤rmstens weiterzuempfehlen und fÃ¼r den Preis ist die Spieldauer von 5-9 Stunden gerechtfertigt.",1427189354,1427189354,True,2,0,0.545454561710357666,0,True,False,False,False,,,

15029946,"{'steamid': '76561198167264194', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 692, 'last_played': 1604831383}",english,"This is a fun game. 14914310,{'steamid': '76561198088833537', 'num_games_owned': 363, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 567, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 123, 'last_played': 1673334445}",english,"As a big fan of the Assassin's series, I though this game would be perfect. The story is new and engaging and the gameplay I expected to be up notch. However, upon play I was disappointed. There are VERY LITTLE to NO turtorials in the begining of this game. No tutorials is fine if this were DLC, as orginally that's what this game was, but if you intend to make this a STANDALONE TITLE, you MUST HAVE TUTORIALS! I skipped out on Pirates as it is too boring for my taste; I bought Freedom Cry because it gave me pirates without the boring story I don't care for. Buy this game if you own pirates, otherwise, stay far far away.

EDIT: Years later I decided to give Freedom Cry a second shot. While the tutorials are still an issue, if you play some other assassin's games, it's significantly easier. The main issue was the beginning ship section. You have two ways to deal with the situation and with no tutorials, it's a mess. But once you're past the beginning, it's very similar to Liberation.",1426478068,1551945250,False,3,0,0.449879884719848633,0,True,False,False,False,,,
